commit_message:
remove py37
Remove python3.7 from setup.cfg, since Wallaby's python
supported runtimes are python 3.6 and python 3.8[1]:

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html

Change-Id: I8f6971b43c5759f3230054ee920d7139971bf51c

commit_message:
Remove xenial-arm64 wheel jobs

Nothing uses Xenial on ARM64, and we don't want anything to start, so
let's remove the nodes.  This removes the wheel publishing jobs.

Change-Id: Ia44c384072c0482cfd11c642013fd51004f85c8b

messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-04-26 07:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-04-26 07:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-04-26 07:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-04-30 21:14:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I mean, this code is fine... I'm just confused about the use case? Are we going to manually remove PBR from ramdisks?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-05-03 12:20:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Once we don't actually use pbr, we can remove its dependency from packaging (RDO in my case) and stop pulling git-core in."}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-05-04 17:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-26 07:17:08.000000000', 'message': 'Remove runtime dependency on pbr

Pbr is a very heavy package to depend on. It requires git-core, which is
16 MiB on my Fedora. We only use it to detect the version, which can be
done without pbr using a much lighter importlib_metadata.

Copied from https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/osprofiler/+/739379

Change-Id: I5f434e6bfde6f645804941f3a36d5458a28270e7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove runtime dependency on pbr

Pbr is a very heavy package to depend on. It requires git-core, which is
16 MiB on my Fedora. We only use it to detect the version, which can be
done without pbr using a much lighter importlib_metadata.

Copied from https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/osprofiler/+/739379

Change-Id: I5f434e6bfde6f645804941f3a36d5458a28270e7

commit_message:
Consolidate Redis install to ensure_packages

Consolidate all the installs of Redis bindings
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we
are using ensure_resources in Aodh and Gnocchi
modules which causes redeclaration issues.

Change-Id: Ib4a277dfb8fa9bc0cd74e88f91006fbc78d72c9e
(cherry picked from commit 4cf58ae78f315549abefdb2fd8d564e817183a7b)

subject: Dropping lower constraints testing
messages: [{'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-04-25 03:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2021-04-27 08:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2021-04-27 12:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2021-05-04 17:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-25 03:05:45.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I95a19854bc55d92b63e1a826daf97e8b58711a07
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I95a19854bc55d92b63e1a826daf97e8b58711a07

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-04-30 01:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2021-05-04 06:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2021-05-04 17:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-30 01:57:25.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I252f80cc3c85da0ecd872397109dd9e35406f2a3

commit_message:
Consolidate Redis install to ensure_packages

Consolidate all the installs of Redis bindings
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we
are using ensure_resources in Aodh and Gnocchi
modules which causes redeclaration issues.

Change-Id: Ia34267859cb79cd5f7491c34c6d80800e2e79f5b
(cherry picked from commit ee532b047e9253099d33adc859c2527339997591)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 09:19:42.000000000', 'message': 'Adding the missing HostDomain config option

The ``HostDomain`` config type have been added few months ago [1]
however the config option have been forgotten and this new type
isn't importable.

When we try to import this type without defining a new related cfg
option we get the following issue:

```
AttributeError: module 'oslo_config.cfg' has no attribute 'HostDomain'
```

These changes allow us to import this new type and allow us to use
it in our configs:

```
>>> from oslo_config import cfg
>>> foo = cfg.HostDomain('foo')
>>> foo.type.__call__("1")
...
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "~/oslo.config/oslo_config/types.py", line 893, in __call__
     raise ValueError(
ValueError: 1 is not a valid host address
>>> foo.type.__call__("host_name")
'host_name'
```

Also properly initialize HostDomain because The HostDomain class wasn't
calling super in it's __init__() method, which resulted in the type_name not
being set properly for instances of that class.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/6480356928c9ae6169ea1e5a5b5f1df3d6e0dc75

Change-Id: Ie947803f61ba0ef080018e0447de894a400d7975
Closes-Bug: 1924283
(cherry picked from commit bb5e4cbeb973c6341bf51eea2ebe5d38366167e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Adding the missing HostDomain config option

The ``HostDomain`` config type have been added few months ago [1]
however the config option have been forgotten and this new type
isn't importable.

When we try to import this type without defining a new related cfg
option we get the following issue:

```
AttributeError: module 'oslo_config.cfg' has no attribute 'HostDomain'
```

These changes allow us to import this new type and allow us to use
it in our configs:

```
>>> from oslo_config import cfg
>>> foo = cfg.HostDomain('foo')
>>> foo.type.__call__("1")
...
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "~/oslo.config/oslo_config/types.py", line 893, in __call__
     raise ValueError(
ValueError: 1 is not a valid host address
>>> foo.type.__call__("host_name")
'host_name'
```

Also properly initialize HostDomain because The HostDomain class wasn't
calling super in it's __init__() method, which resulted in the type_name not
being set properly for instances of that class.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/6480356928c9ae6169ea1e5a5b5f1df3d6e0dc75

Change-Id: Ie947803f61ba0ef080018e0447de894a400d7975
Closes-Bug: 1924283
(cherry picked from commit bb5e4cbeb973c6341bf51eea2ebe5d38366167e8)

commit_message:
Import deployment logic from ironic-lib

The two functions work_on_disk and create_config_drive_partition contain
a substantial part of the deployment logic. Previously we placed them in
ironic-lib for re-using on the conductor side in the iSCSI deploy
interface. Since the iSCSI deploy is going away, we can move this code
to ironic-python-agent to simplify maintenance.

Imports code from ironic_lib commit 9fb5be348202f4854a455cd08f400ae12b99e1f2.

Change-Id: I6cbcd81533f135208b57746cb0e33ffdfaf94eee

commit_message:
Backport version: Validate vmedia for vmedia usage

Virtual media devices based logic needs to be
guarded from being used or considered based upon
if the machine actually booted from virtual media,
or not.

At the same time, actual devices need to be checked
in order to make sure they align with what we expect
in order to prevent consideration of content which
should not be leveraged.

This change includes change Ifffeac9c1c4d394526d655eaa14c9fe7bd3a1e5e
_early_log from Ic64d7842a59795bbf02f194221dedc07c6b56e8c, and
a utility helper from I005613d9f7de8106f31c30abd9c87e0bcd6b9272,
and Ib7518075f3140a8daf06db52317ff10f8572dcc8,
and I79fc069ff07af37bfc8109421f79c3175c4b2749.

Change-Id: If2d5c6f4815c9e42798a2d96d59015e1b1dbd457
Story: 2008749
Task: 42108
(cherry picked from commit 8dd6589e66d03e45e1d510601da9531a30842cff)

commit_message:
Adds spec for supporting @ and . in keypair name

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/allow-special-characters-in-keypair-name

Allowing the '@' and '.' (dot) characters in keypair names will improve
end user experience, as some already try to input names in format user.name@host.
The default comment generated by ssh-keygen that users also try to use,
is also in this format.

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint allow-special-characters-in-keypair-name
Change-Id: I1333842fbac00574887fd1bfe699c8e4185fd334

[{'created': '2021-05-04 02:53:37.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ia98a366c65321f76394940be0f9ce2a55dd321d4
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ia98a366c65321f76394940be0f9ce2a55dd321d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 08:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'Move FFU validations to right playbook.

In [0], the integration of validations was included. However, they
were added into the tas/upgrade/main.yaml playbook instead of
the tasks/fast-forward-upgrade/main.yml playbook, which is the
one being triggered during FFU automation.

Also, it adds back the rescue block in the validation_run_group.yaml
file. As otherwise, if a validation fails then the execution gets
stopped and never gets to run the check for failed validations. And
adds a check for the old release validations.

[0] - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/787411

Change-Id: I2fdd4c3c2c85482cf64f6565ad99cb4b71b00c13
(cherry picked from commit 6fb29a0162bae0c94c178e6991a334eb61e88c9f)
'}]
commit_message:
Move FFU validations to right playbook.

In [0], the integration of validations was included. However, they
were added into the tas/upgrade/main.yaml playbook instead of
the tasks/fast-forward-upgrade/main.yml playbook, which is the
one being triggered during FFU automation.

Also, it adds back the rescue block in the validation_run_group.yaml
file. As otherwise, if a validation fails then the execution gets
stopped and never gets to run the check for failed validations. And
adds a check for the old release validations.

[0] - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/787411

Change-Id: I2fdd4c3c2c85482cf64f6565ad99cb4b71b00c13
(cherry picked from commit 6fb29a0162bae0c94c178e6991a334eb61e88c9f)

commit_message:
Update Nodejs Runtime to Nodejs14 From Nodejs10 for Xena Cycle

This patch update Nodejs version to Nodejs14 From Nodejs10 because
Nodejs10 is going to EOL by April 2021 [1]. So We should use
Nodejs14(current LTS version) as the runtime for the Xena cycle.

[1] https://nodejs.org/en/about/releases/

Change-Id: I1c5bf670267abcb8c8a1937fd594077594010bd2

commit_message:
Use osp_release if it is defined

In order to handle downstream releases, check if osp_release is defined,
and if so, use this in the list_skipped_release, otherwise (in the case
the job is an upstream job) use the normal release variable.

Change-Id: I076dd0c7fbcfe7e95a755a8c568b5f5541392440

In order to cut first major release we need to merge some partially
breaking changes. In order not to affect immediately everyone with that
and have freedom to test things thorougly let's do it in a special
branch.

[{'created': '2021-03-12 15:28:58.000000000', 'message': 'WIP : Adding script to convert queries to sova format

1. Added a few sova regexes in queries
2. Updated requirements file to include PyYaml used in the converter script
3. Added a converter script which :
   - Parses queries.yml
   - Looks for entries which has key "regex" and has "regex" key as true
   - Takes values of keys "id" and "pattern" from the entry and sets them as "name" and "regex" in sova dict
   - Writes sova_dict to sova_pattern_example.json (so as not to overwrite sova_pattern.json right now)

TO DO : Add exceptions, add "patterns" section of sova

Change-Id: Iae3df0d901f2b25bdb27f1b3bea5042f82128dcf

commit_message:
Adding script to convert queries to sova format

- add a few sova regexes in queries
- updated requirements file to include PyYaml used in the converter script
- Added a converter script which :
  - Parses queries.yml
  - If an entry has regex it forms sova query with regex, if the entry
    has patterns but no regex it converts the pattern (string) to regex
    (escapes characters) and forms sova query
  - Writes the sova output to sova-pattern-generated.json (so as not
    to overwrite existing sova_pattern.json right now)

Change-Id: Iae3df0d901f2b25bdb27f1b3bea5042f82128dcf

commit_message:
Removal of ipxe_enabled parameter

This setting has been removed a while ago in ironic [1]. We shouldn't
set it anymore.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/696810

Change-Id: I30f116811f006d7a0647716238bcabf566d80f51

commit_message:
Consolidate Redis install to ensure_packages

Consolidate all the installs of Redis bindings
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we
are using ensure_resources in Aodh and Gnocchi
modules which causes redeclaration issues.

Change-Id: Ib4a277dfb8fa9bc0cd74e88f91006fbc78d72c9e

commit_message:
Updates to flip all libraries back to master

This patchset updates all the requirements for charms.openstack,
charm-helpers, charms.ceph, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests back
to master branch.

Change-Id: I4f72c30fb1afd7c7fb2989c04d9261703e18b941

[{'created': '2021-05-03 21:06:22.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate Redis install to ensure_packages

Consolidate all the installs of Redis bindings
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we

'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate Redis install to ensure_packages

Consolidate all the installs of Redis bindings
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we
are using ensure_resources in Aodh and Gnocchi
modules which causes redeclaration issues.

Change-Id: Ia34267859cb79cd5f7491c34c6d80800e2e79f5b

commit_message:
Remove references to 'sys.version_info'

We support Python 3.6 as a minimum now, making these checks no-ops.

Change-Id: I668c1bddba29a5e823734b1cad5116ba2fdb5f75

This spec is merged in Wallaby release, please refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/sriov-smartnic-support.html

Reproposing this spec with the following changes:

1. ARQ should be bound to instance_uuid instead of port ID becuase
Nova needs wait for notification from Cyborg per instance.
2. Server with ARQ in the port does not support move and suspend,
we reject related operations with 403 Error.
3. We limit that one port could only be associated with one device.
4. We reject the operation when there are compute nodes with old version
which don't support this feature.

Change-Id: I79c4f201d97ea7ba7d5f8026d2655df8b5934be6

Change-Id: I79c4f201d97ea7ba7d5f8026d2655df8b5934be6

commit_message:
Repropose smartnic support spec

This spec is merged in Wallaby release, please refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/sriov-smartnic-support.html

Reproposing this spec with the following changes:

1. ARQ should be bound to instance_uuid instead of port ID becuase
Nova needs wait for notification from Cyborg per instance.
2. Server with ARQ in the port does not support move and suspend,
we reject related operations with 400 Error.
3. We limit that one port could only be associated with one device.
4. We reject the operation when there are compute nodes with old version
which don't support this feature.

Change-Id: I79c4f201d97ea7ba7d5f8026d2655df8b5934be6

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I2b6c5e82a9da6e163e9d6b1f103ad350c43c0de6

commit_message:
Validate vmedia for vmedia usage

Virtual media devices based logic needs to be
guarded from being used or considered based upon
if the machine actually booted from virtual media,
or not.

At the same time, actual devices need to be checked
in order to make sure they align with what we expect
in order to prevent consideration of content which
should not be leveraged.

Change-Id: If2d5c6f4815c9e42798a2d96d59015e1b1dbd457
Story: 2008749
Task: 42108

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-23 11:57:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix sporadic cleanup unit test failure

From time to time we see unit test
test_do_cleanup_not_cleaning_already_claimed_by_us failing at the gate
with error:

    testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 1 != 0

This happens because the test was assuming that the machine running the
code would get different times in consecutive utcnow() calls, which
sometimes is not the case if the machine is fast.

The places where the call is expected to have different values are:

- When the test assigns original_time
- When the test assigns other_thread_claimed_time
- When cinder.manager.CleanableManager.do_cleanup assigns until

This patch fixes this issue by simulating that:

- worker1 entry was created in the past (original_time is T-1)

- db's worker_get_all is mocked to simulate that worker2 entry was
  created in the past (T-1)

- simulate that another thread has picked up the worker2 entry by
  writing a newer time in the DB (other_thread_claimed_time)

- making sure that the do_cleanup method uses a time between these two
  (T)

This way we will no longer rely on the values returned by utcnow().

Change-Id: I45f1a057151e749e8c44f266ec8b41a80761ebec
(cherry picked from commit 1c3cda154f85dd09041a8d93f4d29d9ebc57a47b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix sporadic cleanup unit test failure

From time to time we see unit test
test_do_cleanup_not_cleaning_already_claimed_by_us failing at the gate
with error:

    testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 1 != 0

This happens because the test was assuming that the machine running the
code would get different times in consecutive utcnow() calls, which
sometimes is not the case if the machine is fast.

The places where the call is expected to have different values are:

- When the test assigns original_time
- When the test assigns other_thread_claimed_time
- When cinder.manager.CleanableManager.do_cleanup assigns until

This patch fixes this issue by simulating that:

- worker1 entry was created in the past (original_time is T-1)

- db's worker_get_all is mocked to simulate that worker2 entry was
  created in the past (T-1)

- simulate that another thread has picked up the worker2 entry by
  writing a newer time in the DB (other_thread_claimed_time)

- making sure that the do_cleanup method uses a time between these two
  (T)

This way we will no longer rely on the values returned by utcnow().

Change-Id: I45f1a057151e749e8c44f266ec8b41a80761ebec
(cherry picked from commit 1c3cda154f85dd09041a8d93f4d29d9ebc57a47b)

commit_message:
Ignore already deleted lease

When we try and release a lease, we might get an object not found
exception meaning that the lease doesn't exist.  So there is no need
to release something that doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I7912a7adf95f97074ee41441d7bfb8d2405b6533

commit_message:
Bump reqirements to tripleo-common>=16.0.0

Now that tripleo-common==16.0.0 is released, we can require it in
tripleo-ansibl. The release contains
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/787819
so we can remove the try/except import handling.

commit_message:
Use environment files when building image params

Also moves deployed-server-environment.yaml before
the user environments as it resets
OS::TripleO::DeployedServer::ControlPlanePort.

Regression from I8fb6ca088b1052488ff4f9ada4d3ab29c0be4735

Closes-Bug: #1926758
Change-Id: I1a6da2e92cc994240f53e8d702f61d941b6a37f7

commit_message:
Fix the failure of share create form snapshot specifies'--availability-zone'

When creating a share form snapshot, the availability_zone variable
is the'id' of the availability_zones database, and the source_share_az
variable is the'name' of the availability_zones database,
which will cause the logical judgment to fail and an exception
will be thrown.

Closes-Bug: #1925435
Change-Id: I6b82f8f4eb821ce5c150f6a929b1304a317c961c

commit_message:
Check if both swift and rgw are enabled during Upgrade Prepare

As per [1] RGW is now deployed by default when the cephadm envs
are included. However, during the upgrade procedure we should
warn users if both services are enabled, failing early during
the update or upgrade prepare step and suggesting that the
cephadm-rbd-only env should be added to make sure Swift is kept
and RGW is not automatically included in the heat stack.
This change introduces this kind of check, and an exception is
raised if the stack already exists, Ceph is deployed by TripleO
and swift is found in the previosly created stack.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/786827

Change-Id: I32387f19346697655355e15b3cf4ff41bd303b08

subject: Add logic to execute validation groups in updates/upgrades.
messages: [{'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2021-04-29 10:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2021-05-04 08:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-29 10:35:51.000000000', 'message': "Add logic to execute validation groups in updates/upgrades.

This commit reshapes the existing updates logic to allow running validations
groups in a more generic way. Including a task file in which the following
is executed:
- Execute the group being passed validation_group if it's included in
  the validation_allowed_groups.
- Log the output into a log file.
- Retrieve the validations results and fail if there is any validation
  failed.
- Log all the tasks executed in each failed validation.

At the same time, this patch invokes the pre-upgrade validation group for
FFU, both before starting with the upgrade (which uses mistral to trigger
the validation in OSP13 [0]) and before starting with the overcloud upgrade
(which uses the new validations framework).

[0] - https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_openstack_platform/16.1/html/framework_for_upgrades_13_to_16.1/planning-and-preparation-for-an-in-place-openstack-platform-upgrade#validating-red-hat-openstack-platform-oldvernum-before-the-upgrade

Change-Id: I4c70a209283051b3e405bb24e03f555cf3802d94
(cherry picked from commit c945f00f97453018d1b5e531c981dad41fb2a21a)
"}]
commit_message:
Add logic to execute validation groups in updates/upgrades.

This commit reshapes the existing updates logic to allow running validations
groups in a more generic way. Including a task file in which the following
is executed:
- Execute the group being passed validation_group if it's included in
  the validation_allowed_groups.
- Log the output into a log file.
- Retrieve the validations results and fail if there is any validation
  failed.
- Log all the tasks executed in each failed validation.

At the same time, this patch invokes the pre-upgrade validation group for
FFU, both before starting with the upgrade (which uses mistral to trigger
the validation in OSP13 [0]) and before starting with the overcloud upgrade
(which uses the new validations framework).

[0] - https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_openstack_platform/16.1/html/framework_for_upgrades_13_to_16.1/planning-and-preparation-for-an-in-place-openstack-platform-upgrade#validating-red-hat-openstack-platform-oldvernum-before-the-upgrade

Change-Id: I4c70a209283051b3e405bb24e03f555cf3802d94
(cherry picked from commit c945f00f97453018d1b5e531c981dad41fb2a21a)

[{'created': '2021-05-03 21:15:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix list_eol_stale_branches.sh to list only stale branches

clone_repo script does not fail if the branch does not exist, but
checks out the master branch [1], so we have to make sure the required
branch exists.

This patch also adds a check that there were no more patches merged
after the given branch was tagged EOL.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/tools/clone_repo.sh#L187

Change-Id: Ia1ededfc3cebbae807719750dc5e2d5949ce9a21
'}]
commit_message:
Fix list_eol_stale_branches.sh to list only stale branches

clone_repo script does not fail if the branch does not exist, but
checks out the master branch [1], so we have to make sure the required
branch exists.

This patch also adds a check that there were no more patches merged
after the given branch was tagged EOL.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/tools/clone_repo.sh#L187

Change-Id: Ia1ededfc3cebbae807719750dc5e2d5949ce9a21

Remove the import alias, which is same as package name.

Import alias is same as original package, so making the alias unnecessary.

Change-Id: I94c23131ee96447be133e33dbda4b443c19d681a

commit_message:
Consolidate device detach error handling

After I7f2b6330decb92e2838aa7cee47fb228f00f47da the error handling of
the callers of _detach_with_retry() can be consolidated. Libvirt related
errors now handled in _detach_sync() and various DeviceNotFound cases
now don't need special handling on the caller side.

Change-Id: Ic6eb66bc2396949aceecda50bda334a1bc7dab31

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 10:57:36.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Only account for bound ports in metadata agent

Due to bug #1922934 there might be situations with stale ports
in the OVN database. When instances request metadata, the agent
will try to fetch all ports for that particular network with the
same IP address and there should be only one.

However, when there are stale ports in OVN database but not in
Neutron, those ports may have the same IP address and the result
is that metadata won't work. As the stale ports will never be
bound to any hypervisor, this patch is accounting only for
bound ports so that those ports don't interfere until they
eventually get fixed by the maintenance task.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/agent/metadata/server.py
	networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py

Related-Bug: #1922934
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I708904b982d243359f2eeda809beae0321f1a7db
(cherry picked from commit 32e938e698f260af6896f6179a5ffc0838677124)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Only account for bound ports in metadata agent

Due to bug #1922934 there might be situations with stale ports
in the OVN database. When instances request metadata, the agent
will try to fetch all ports for that particular network with the
same IP address and there should be only one.

However, when there are stale ports in OVN database but not in
Neutron, those ports may have the same IP address and the result
is that metadata won't work. As the stale ports will never be
bound to any hypervisor, this patch is accounting only for
bound ports so that those ports don't interfere until they
eventually get fixed by the maintenance task.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/agent/metadata/server.py
	networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py

Related-Bug: #1922934
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I708904b982d243359f2eeda809beae0321f1a7db
(cherry picked from commit 32e938e698f260af6896f6179a5ffc0838677124)

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 31825, 'date': '2021-05-04 09:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-05-04 12:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 09:15:55.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ic42d1e9fd6d41de78fd47b1836741c4f4cb47e6f
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ic42d1e9fd6d41de78fd47b1836741c4f4cb47e6f

Updates to flip all libraries back to master

This patchset updates all the requirements for charms.openstack,
charm-helpers, charms.ceph, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests back
to master branch.

commit_message:
Add /run/netns bind mount to neutron_lbaas_agent

It fixes "failed to open netns" issues which can be seen after a restart
of neutron_lbaas_agent.

The same bind mount was added to the DHCP and L3 agents in change
I725eeb18a22b3fa7838f16761d19f7e699ab5e82.

Change-Id: Iebc63db1dad40496c6b7aec9137dd0d4a76d2496
Closes-Bug: #1926740

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Iaa54c3c176d1dfb8e8a7e882640741419116d4c0

subject: Don't install dhcp-all-interfaces for redhat 8 onwards
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-04-27 22:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-02 22:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-03 18:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 22:01:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't install dhcp-all-interfaces for redhat 8 onwards

This element was needed for centos-7 and earlier because by default
only the first interface had dhcp enabled. This is no longer the case
with centos-8, every interface has dhcp enabled. Additionally this
element is causing issues in some environments.

This change removes the element from all *-8 images since it no longer
serves a useful purpose and is causing problems in some cases.

Change-Id: I2cc79caeabd9d1b85f54320a83e5f36a64003303
(cherry picked from commit af9329599bec35e241db8466ec172e7d498ad6ea)
(cherry picked from commit a575fd8d639e4e37819e5bc1d7352902119df996)
(cherry picked from commit 813a7382be66058086c78c0c05602f7ae963b9ac)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install dhcp-all-interfaces for redhat 8 onwards

This element was needed for centos-7 and earlier because by default
only the first interface had dhcp enabled. This is no longer the case
with centos-8, every interface has dhcp enabled. Additionally this
element is causing issues in some environments.

This change removes the element from all *-8 images since it no longer
serves a useful purpose and is causing problems in some cases.

Change-Id: I2cc79caeabd9d1b85f54320a83e5f36a64003303
(cherry picked from commit af9329599bec35e241db8466ec172e7d498ad6ea)
(cherry picked from commit a575fd8d639e4e37819e5bc1d7352902119df996)
(cherry picked from commit 813a7382be66058086c78c0c05602f7ae963b9ac)

commit_message:
Add tripleo_ovn_cluster role

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVN's own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

THT service: https://review.opendev.org/775444

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I5baa697ae351d10e53f7cf70641fe0eecede507f

commit_message:
Don't assume Ironic is installed

During "overcloud node provision", pre-provisioned nodes can be
specified with managed:false, in which case the node provision is just a
data transformation process to prepare the inputs for Heat. The ansible
modules should not assume that Ironic is installed in this case, as the
enable_ironic option has existed for many releases already.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I3657169a3b519869f7f3594c8c6a6072a058e0c8
Change-Id: I2bc8f3d8090b2753f636832600d3bd51424ba7e7

commit_message:
Write hosts entries per environment

This change will write /etc/hosts entries per plan
rather than stomping the hosts entries every time
the role is used for different stacks / plans.

We achieve this by differentiating the blocks of IP
addresses to ensure they are not modified by unrelated
executions of the role.

Closes-Bug: #1924751
Resolves: rhbz#1933528
Depends-On: I9e53187f37d41d7180e66db1239b5f9c8846addd
Change-Id: I7396ad4d25fec44000ead88b24e818abc107b5f8

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I446946d7abe4266d509ddbb34e0119334003a0b2

Artem, is it something that worth to be done in SDK perhaps?'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2021-04-30 01:54:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Artem, is it something that worth to be done in SDK perhaps?

Do you meaning the openstacksdk?  openstacksdk works properly,  just need specify the nova_compute_api_version.. but in ansible, we don't know which api_version we may used. so change the empty to 0 maybe a good idea.because we don't need to care which api version we used"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-05-04 08:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

if flavor's swap is not set (or 0),nova returns empty string [0]
rather than 0 when query flavor spec. this behavior will break
the idempotent of the ansible deployment. this ps changes the empty
string to 0 before compare them.
[0]: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-flavors-detail,list-flavors-with-details-detail#list-flavors-with-details

Change-Id: I041cbcc0432051d795e2c3f0e7ac7378e1970008
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the idempotent of compute_flavor module

if flavor's swap is not set (or 0),nova returns empty string [0]
rather than 0 when query flavor spec. this behavior will break
the idempotent of the ansible deployment. this ps changes the empty
string to 0 before compare them.
[0]: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-flavors-detail,list-flavors-with-details-detail#list-flavors-with-details

Change-Id: I041cbcc0432051d795e2c3f0e7ac7378e1970008

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 00:07:56.000000000', 'message': 'statsd: use timedelta and pipeline

statsd timing() can take a timedelta directly; avoid the conversion
and let the library handle it.  We can also put the multiple results
into a pipeline and save a network call/packet for each API action by
grouping the two stats sent.

Change-Id: Ib18df2cd8e06d9d1bf59fac7eb940b5158b8bd96
'}]
commit_message:
statsd: use timedelta and pipeline

statsd timing() can take a timedelta directly; avoid the conversion
and let the library handle it.  We can also put the multiple results
into a pipeline and save a network call/packet for each API action by
grouping the two stats sent.

Change-Id: Ib18df2cd8e06d9d1bf59fac7eb940b5158b8bd96

commit_message:
Switch nodepool test to containers

The nodepool-functional-container-openstack-siblings builds nodepool
container images (with openstacksdk and other "siblings" of nodepool
from source) and runs the build/boot tests with that.

The container builds of these tools are what OpenDev uses in
production, so this is more practical testing than installing by parts
on a bare Bionic system.  This allows us to remove the job duplication
in nodepool.

Backport note: this backport uses centos-8 stream job, which was
introduced with 97ccea4683bfd607393b00f9a0cb83620f69b363.  This should
allow us to remove the non-container versions of these jobs from
nodepool tree

Cherry-picked from 5db7d5573a1afaed7d7b5805f3832e02354ee6a4
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/nodepool/+/788406
Change-Id: I91345ebf509238ca1f800cb595818c023cc56b0d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 08:58:49.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough

"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icd54fc860f354787bfd16da7d47e705523305094

[{'created': '2021-04-27 15:49:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RBD incremental restore

When using RBD incremental restores with more than one pool, aka
a non-default container, Cinder still tries to get the restore
point from the pool/container configured in configuration which
results in a failure.

Change-Id: I3ab790e4687f45264fc316a72a8e131147a73cac
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RBD incremental restore

When using RBD incremental restores with more than one pool, aka
a non-default container, Cinder still tries to get the restore
point from the pool/container configured in configuration which
results in a failure.

Change-Id: I3ab790e4687f45264fc316a72a8e131147a73cac

[{'created': '2021-05-04 08:46:01.000000000', 'message': 'Sync full /etc/leapp/files directory.

To make the leapp upgrade procedure a little bit simpler the two files
required by leapp to work, repomap.csv and pes-events.json, were being
retrieved from the Undercloud node to the Overcloud nodes. However, the
leapp tool now requires two new files to work properly, which are not
being considered in the upgrade tasks, making the upgrade for the
overcloud nodes fail.

To avoid that the addition of new file requirements will break the
Overcloud leapp upgrade, this patch synchronizes the whole content
under /etc/leapp/files from the Undercloud to the Overcloud nodes using
find, fetch and copy.

Change-Id: I765dc048016bb92462ccd55132e48a61ef8a9ecd
Resolves: rhbz#1953540
(cherry picked from commit 20561e86cf71a957b7532d304552b150f12d1fe3)
'}]
commit_message:
Sync full /etc/leapp/files directory.

To make the leapp upgrade procedure a little bit simpler the two files
required by leapp to work, repomap.csv and pes-events.json, were being
retrieved from the Undercloud node to the Overcloud nodes. However, the
leapp tool now requires two new files to work properly, which are not
being considered in the upgrade tasks, making the upgrade for the
overcloud nodes fail.

To avoid that the addition of new file requirements will break the
Overcloud leapp upgrade, this patch synchronizes the whole content
under /etc/leapp/files from the Undercloud to the Overcloud nodes using
find, fetch and copy.

Change-Id: I765dc048016bb92462ccd55132e48a61ef8a9ecd
Resolves: rhbz#1953540
(cherry picked from commit 20561e86cf71a957b7532d304552b150f12d1fe3)

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I1478cde66cb4a0501095c9147a5bbccf312aa4db

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3c3e365a9b7ab75fd0933cdcab838699fae2ff4e

commit_message:
Improve handling of memory retrieval from introspection data

If the memory_mb=0 in Ironic's introspection data, get the
memory from inventory/memory/total.

Closes-Bug: #1926492
Change-Id: I0040186b79925f6b715c53838a4a8e912f4477c3

commit_message:
Write hosts entries per environment

This change will write /etc/hosts entries per plan
rather than stomping the hosts entries every time
the role is used for different stacks / plans.

We achieve this by differentiating the blocks of IP
addresses to ensure they are not modified by unrelated
executions of the role.

Closes-Bug: #1924751
Resolves: rhbz#1933528
Depends-On: I9e53187f37d41d7180e66db1239b5f9c8846addd
Change-Id: I7396ad4d25fec44000ead88b24e818abc107b5f8

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name

messages:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-30 13:39:04.000000000', 'message': "Config parameters for timemaster service

timemaster service provides HA between different
time service i.e chrony, PTP. When timemaster service runs,
it spwans instances/child processes of chronyd, ptp4l and
phy2sys. Look at below output.

[root@hareshcomputesriov-0 heat-admin]# systemctl status timemaster
● timemaster.service - Synchronize system clock to NTP and PTP time
                       sources
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/timemaster.service; disabled;
                   vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Tue 2020-08-11 17:24:45 UTC; 3s ago
 Main PID: 544428 (timemaster)
    Tasks: 4 (limit: 357097)
   Memory: 2.4M
   CGroup: /system.slice/timemaster.service
           ├─544428 /usr/sbin/timemaster -f /etc/timemaster.conf
           ├─544429 /usr/sbin/chronyd -n
                                      -f /var/run/timemaster/chrony.conf
           ├─544430 /usr/sbin/ptp4l -l 5
                                    -f /var/run/timemaster/ptp4l.0.conf
                                    -H -i eno1
           └─544431 /usr/sbin/phc2sys -l 5 -a -r -R 1.00
                                   -z /var/run/timemaster/ptp4l.0.socket
                                   -t [0:eno1] -n 0 -E ntpshm -M 0

Timemaster service uses /etc/chrony.conf and /etc/ptp4l.conf to create
runtime instance for these 2 timeservices. These 2 time services sync to
their respective time source. Timemaster provides HA between chrony
and PTP (between different PTP domains as well which is not part of
this patch).Timemaster compares all time sources and use the best
sources to synchronize the system clock. if chronyd commuication breaks
then timemaster will set system time with PTP grand master's provided
time and vice a versa.

2 new parameters added by this patch in order to make above work.

In order to use timemaster service, we need to remove Timesync and
add TimeMaster in roles_data.yaml for the role we desire to have
Timemaster service.

    - OS::TripleO::Services::TimeMaster

Change-Id: I32e9d17132d188aaddc5f5be578643a5f25ea375
Closes-Bug: #1893025
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748431/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749093/
(cherry picked from commit 98c48b2299a9a4d4cc618d417f1fcd686e99b536)
"}]
commit_message:
Config parameters for timemaster service

timemaster service provides HA between different
time service i.e chrony, PTP. When timemaster service runs,
it spwans instances/child processes of chronyd, ptp4l and
phy2sys. Look at below output.

[root@hareshcomputesriov-0 heat-admin]# systemctl status timemaster
● timemaster.service - Synchronize system clock to NTP and PTP time
                       sources
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/timemaster.service; disabled;
                   vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Tue 2020-08-11 17:24:45 UTC; 3s ago
 Main PID: 544428 (timemaster)
    Tasks: 4 (limit: 357097)
   Memory: 2.4M
   CGroup: /system.slice/timemaster.service
           ├─544428 /usr/sbin/timemaster -f /etc/timemaster.conf
           ├─544429 /usr/sbin/chronyd -n
                                      -f /var/run/timemaster/chrony.conf
           ├─544430 /usr/sbin/ptp4l -l 5
                                    -f /var/run/timemaster/ptp4l.0.conf
                                    -H -i eno1
           └─544431 /usr/sbin/phc2sys -l 5 -a -r -R 1.00
                                   -z /var/run/timemaster/ptp4l.0.socket
                                   -t [0:eno1] -n 0 -E ntpshm -M 0

Timemaster service uses /etc/chrony.conf and /etc/ptp4l.conf to create
runtime instance for these 2 timeservices. These 2 time services sync to
their respective time source. Timemaster provides HA between chrony
and PTP (between different PTP domains as well which is not part of
this patch).Timemaster compares all time sources and use the best
sources to synchronize the system clock. if chronyd commuication breaks
then timemaster will set system time with PTP grand master's provided
time and vice a versa.

2 new parameters added by this patch in order to make above work.

In order to use timemaster service, we need to remove Timesync and
add TimeMaster in roles_data.yaml for the role we desire to have
Timemaster service.

    - OS::TripleO::Services::TimeMaster

Change-Id: I32e9d17132d188aaddc5f5be578643a5f25ea375
Closes-Bug: #1893025
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748431/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749093/
(cherry picked from commit 98c48b2299a9a4d4cc618d417f1fcd686e99b536)

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I383ffa2860f8f1e5065a5e5980e9cba6985a853e

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ie91a35d8ead1a182c3e0c74ca3ca604d4414784d

commit_message:
Drop support for SQLite < 3.7

Both Ubuntu 18.04 [1] and CentOS 8 [2] provide sufficiently new versions
of SQLite that make this check unnecessary now.

[1] https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/sqlite3
[2] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/

Change-Id: I42900037e69f5cc49044dfbcbb27057b67e2056d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-03-09 21:28:31.000000000', 'message': '[Pure] Fix failing consistency group tempest tests

Currently CG tests have to be disabled due to this failing test. This
test will never succeed because the underlying array cannot create a
condition where this type of failure would occur.
This test has never passed due to the underlying fundamental
misunderstanding of the arrays internal logic mechanisms and should
never have been in the test suite in the first place.

Change-Id: I4923cda0e7b747c141203a024c325c4d2b8cea02
(cherry picked from commit 41101463a859a8dfb3ce06330ce50c380efe6209)
'}]
commit_message:
[Pure] Fix failing consistency group tempest tests

Currently CG tests have to be disabled due to this failing test. This
test will never succeed because the underlying array cannot create a
condition where this type of failure would occur.
This test has never passed due to the underlying fundamental
misunderstanding of the arrays internal logic mechanisms and should
never have been in the test suite in the first place.

Change-Id: I4923cda0e7b747c141203a024c325c4d2b8cea02
(cherry picked from commit 41101463a859a8dfb3ce06330ce50c380efe6209)

commit_message:
Updates to flip all libraries back to master

This patchset updates all the requirements for charms.openstack,
charm-helpers, charms.ceph, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests back
to master branch.

Change-Id: I99fbbf9010f40b77054192e5718c983449c4c71d

commit_message:
Update basic local.conf for quickstart

Updating the local.conf example basic configuration for development
quickstart based on recent updates.
This has been tested on ubuntu focal, current base opearting system used
for CI jobs.

Change-Id: I102bef55bef1c944991fbcba7547cd51c03fc7be

commit_message:
Use consistent working dir for ansible-runner

Instead of using tmp dirs for ansible-runner, use the consistent working
directory, which allows for saving the output for debugging and
reproducability.

Change-Id: I83ad02817ace364eb4bc596127cfd7d6699c32aa
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 31412, 'date': '2021-04-29 12:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-04 02:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-29 12:19:27.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I9fbe0a7028c20362a73bbbeeddb2a34f876d186b
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I9fbe0a7028c20362a73bbbeeddb2a34f876d186b

Change-Id: Idd508bbee06ab8cb56e9fa4d70511463c4bc8021
'}]
commit_message:
Updates to flip all libraries back to master

This patchset updates all the requirements for charms.openstack,
charm-helpers, charms.ceph, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests back
to master branch.

Change-Id: Idd508bbee06ab8cb56e9fa4d70511463c4bc8021

commit_message:
Label temporary files created by image_utils

These files can be rather large at times, prefix
them with identifiers so that when troubleshooting
Cinder, it is possible to identify what is
consuming disk space.

Closes-Bug: #1911766
Change-Id: I660ed16a36ad9415a5de757b32a6770e27b1294c
(cherry picked from commit 3ce9d773aa233829d1dcbae2f9e1aebecd248305)
(cherry picked from commit d94f8032b31934076c64153cf37fed095a7c8177)

commit_message:
Remove redundant container updating after rsync

In today's swift, information abount reporting in container db
get reset after rsync, and container-updater tries to update
its account again from new position.
However, when a container db is rsynced after its account is
already reclaimed, the container never succeeds its updating,
and gets unreclaimable.

This patch removes that redundant retry of container-updating
after rsync which may cause unreclaimable containers.

Change-Id: Ibad70663887a6687904edbd6232704345f97b92c
Closes-Bug: #1332439

@paul
I'll reply to some of your comments here.

> in object PUT if the container server can't be reached it will count on the object-updater.
It will count on the object-updater, also if the container is missing.

> In the account server PUT code it looks like 404 is because the account is deleted, why is that something we shouldn't error on and expect it to work later on?
When putting/deleteing container, swift checks an existence of account in ContainerController.PUT.
If the account is deleted, proxy-server returns 404 before it sends requests to container-servers, so we don't have to check it again at update processing in container-server."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-24 08:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

So, this is somewhat similiar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266190/.

And I have the same doubt in this case, take the following example:

 swift post container

 # Now stop two primary account servers
 swift-get-nodes /etc/swift/account.ring.gz AUTH_test 
 sudo swift-init stop -c 4 account-server
 sudo swift-init stop -c 2 account-server

 # Let's delete the container
 swift delete container

 # All servers available again
 sudo swift-init restart account-server

 # Normally this would fail on a deleted container
 swift upload container testobj

IMO this is wrong. Normally Swift either succeeds with a quorum, or fails. But in this case we get a success back from the DELETE operation, but in fact it "disappears" due to some actions (an upload in this case) before replicators run.

I'm worried that there are even more unwanted sideeffects if we weaken it, therefore a -1 for now.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2016-01-15 01:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

@Christian

>  # Now stop two primary account servers
>  swift-get-nodes /etc/swift/account.ring.gz AUTH_test 
>  sudo swift-init stop -c 4 account-server
>  sudo swift-init stop -c 2 account-server
Nothing is changed by this patch if the account-servers are "down".
This patch only deals when the account replica is messing.

>  # Let's delete the container
>  swift delete container
So let me talk about the things when two account replicas are missing(or placed at hand off)
Without my patch, swift will return 404 for this, even though containers exists and now get marked as deleted.
With my patch, swift will return 204, because it succees to delete containers, and leave updating jobs for container-updaters.

>  # Normally this would fail on a deleted container
>  swift upload container testobj
In both case this will fail, because all container replicas are marked as deleted.

Let me show how it works in some situations, in next my comment.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2016-01-15 01:38:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I'll show 3 replicas case.
At first, this patch only affects container PUT/DELETE.

Case 1. some account-servers are down
Nothing is changed with this patch.

Case 2. 1 account replicas are missing
In both case, swift return 201/202 for container PUT and 404 for container DELETE.
Here all containers are deleted and 2 accounts get report about deleting.

(Internally, without this patch swift will get 201,201,404 from container servers when PUTting container, 204,204,404 when DELETEing container)

Case 3. 2 or 3 account replicas are missing
Without this patch, swift returns 404 for container PUT, even though it creates containers. This patch makes swift return 201 or 202.
Without this patch, swift returns 404 for container DELETE, even though it deletes containers. This patch makes swift return 204.

So at this point this patch makes swift to return appropriate status for what it has done."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2016-01-15 01:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

NOTE: In case 3, 3 container replicas are generated in PUT, and all 3 contaier replicas get deleted in DELETE.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2016-01-15 01:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

NOTE: In case 3, 3 container replicas are generated in PUT, and all 3 contaier replicas get deleted in DELETE.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2016-01-15 01:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

NOTE: In case 3, 3 container replicas are generated in PUT, and all 3 contaier replicas get deleted in DELETE.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2016-01-15 01:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Sorry for my dupulicated comments.
I met 503 from gerrit and somthing went wrong...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-20 03:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified-1

[{'created': '2014-04-16 09:29:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the inconsistency between container PUT and object PUT when update failed

This patch fixes the following inconsistency between container PUT and
object PUT.

* When we PUT container to swift, swift returns error(404)
  if the greater part of the account replicas are missed.

* When we PUT object, swift returns success(201),
  even if the greater part of the container replicas are missed.

Change-Id: I3fa100a5c06b72df0186e67391706070981b3350
Closes-Bug: #1293945
'}, {'created': '2014-04-17 03:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Make container PUT and DELETE to allow asynchronous updating to account

In container PUT and DELETE, swift checks synchronous account updating,
and returns error(404) if it misses the greater part of accounts in
primary nodes.

This patch makes swift to allow missing accounts in updating when
we PUT or DELETE container, and swift will leave updating accounts
to container-updater. This behavior is the same as container PUT and
DELETE, in which swift leaves updating containers to object-updater
when it failed to update container because of missing containers.

Change-Id: I3fa100a5c06b72df0186e67391706070981b3350
Closes-Bug: #1293945

commit_message:
Fix 404 in container PUT when the majority of the accounts are missing

In container PUT and DELETE, swift checks synchronous account updating,
and returns error(404) if it misses the greater part of accounts in
primary nodes.

When the majority of the account replicas are placed at handoff nodes,
we get error code(404) in container PUT and DELETE every time until
replicator moves these replicas in handoff nodes to primary nodes.

This patch makes swift to allow missing accounts in updating when
we PUT or DELETE container, and swift will leave updating accounts
to container-updater. This is same as object PUT/DELETE.

Change-Id: I3fa100a5c06b72df0186e67391706070981b3350
Closes-Bug: #1293945

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 02:10:49.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I4dd73d14a350074b77378dcc9442db8e9bfa0723
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I4dd73d14a350074b77378dcc9442db8e9bfa0723

Is the addition of .gitkeep a mistake?'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-03-15 12:58:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Is the addition of .gitkeep a mistake?

Nevermind; you are doing this as a placeholder to preserve the .ansible-lint_rules directory.

I'm not sure if I like keeping around directories just in case, and if we do, we should be explicit about it.

I'd suggest either:

1) We add a README instead of the hidden file (just a one liner declaring the point of the dir)

or

2) We lose the directory and add it down the road if we want it

Thoughts?

David"}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-03-18 07:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove RoleNames ansible-lint custom rule

As this rule has been merged upstream, we don't need it anymore locally.

This patch also bumps the ansible-lint release from v4.2.0 to v5.0.3

It also mocks the following roles to pass the --syntax-check:
- fetch-devstack-log-dir
- fetch-output
- fetch-python-sdist-output
- fetch-subunit-output
- ensure-if-python
- ensure-pip
- ensure-tox
- ensure-virtualenv

Finally, it deletes two empty molecule verify.yml playbooks which are
causing the linter to fail.

Change-Id: I132e2144835724ec82eb0a9aee1996d1e1c3e5fb
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-28 15:04:37.000000000', 'message': 'Move away from md5 digests in managing octavia amphora images

This patch changes the image management code from using deprecated md5
checksum methods to sha digests.

This patch also fixes amphora update code so it uses the checksum of the
image after conversion to raw if it raw conversion was enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1843059

messages: [{'account_id': 31828, 'date': '2021-05-03 01:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30449, 'date': '2021-05-03 01:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nlgtm'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2021-05-03 06:07:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2021-05-03 14:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-05-03 22:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-03 01:08:05.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I238b4e0ca237bca97236004856596002d088220c
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I238b4e0ca237bca97236004856596002d088220c

commit_message:
Add a service_user section to nova.conf

This is needed in order to prevent long-running actions like
live-migration from failing if the user provided token expires
in the meantime. [0],[1]

Add minor version bump for stable branch.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/train/admin/live-migration-usage.html#addressing-migration-timeouts
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/train/admin/support-compute.html#user-token-timeout

Change-Id: I00e3a6ac974b73b56b49fadc7751f1c0aaf292ac
(cherry picked from commit a581a52dd68d903af7562b825b7041e16fdc2212)

commit_message:
Overcloud image has missing kernel_id and ramdisk_id properties

Kernel and ramdisk images are found nonexistent when "file://"
is prepended to the image path, so replace it with empty
string only when checking the existence of the image

Closes-Bug: #1896262
Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I641dd1c3426048f5aace0ac695eb8cef7126f8c2
(cherry picked from commit 6546970a7304e8d3109e99e980053d15d5769598)

[root@hareshcomputesriov-0 heat-admin]# systemctl status timemaster
● timemaster.service - Synchronize system clock to NTP and PTP time
                       sources

"}]
commit_message:
Support for timemaster service with tripleo-ansible role

timemaster service provides provides HA between different
time service i.e chrony, PTP. When timemaster service runs,
it spwans instances/child processes of chronyd, ptp4l and
phy2sys. Look at below output.

[root@hareshcomputesriov-0 heat-admin]# systemctl status timemaster
● timemaster.service - Synchronize system clock to NTP and PTP time
                       sources
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/timemaster.service; disabled;
                   vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: active (running) since Tue 2020-08-11 17:24:45 UTC; 3s ago
 Main PID: 544428 (timemaster)
    Tasks: 4 (limit: 357097)
   Memory: 2.4M
   CGroup: /system.slice/timemaster.service
           ├─544428 /usr/sbin/timemaster -f /etc/timemaster.conf
           ├─544429 /usr/sbin/chronyd -n
                                      -f /var/run/timemaster/chrony.conf
           ├─544430 /usr/sbin/ptp4l -l 5
                                    -f /var/run/timemaster/ptp4l.0.conf
                                    -H -i eno1
           └─544431 /usr/sbin/phc2sys -l 5 -a -r -R 1.00
                                   -z /var/run/timemaster/ptp4l.0.socket
                                   -t [0:eno1] -n 0 -E ntpshm -M 0

Timemaster service uses /etc/chrony.conf and /etc/ptp4l.conf to create
runtime instance for these 2 timeservices. These 2 time services sync to
their respective time source. Timemaster provides HA between chrony
and PTP (between different PTP domains as well which is not part of
this patch).Timemaster compares all time sources and use the best
sources to synchronize the system clock. if chronyd commuication breaks
then timemaster will set system time with PTP grand master's provided
time and vice a versa.

Change-Id: I03953059f96079fbb61899d16147007b2fe023ad
(cherry picked from commit c4950ce46e28fa87c7dcb0971ae3582a04d83021)

commit_message:
New test cases for "zone recordsets" test suite

1) "test_show_recordsets_impersonate_another_project"
   As Admin tenant show recordset for another tenant
   using "x-auth-sudo-project-id" HTTP header.

2) "test_admin_list_all_recordsets_for_a_project"
   As Admin tenant list all recordsets for another tenant
   using "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header.

3) "test_create_recordset_for_other_tenant"
   Try to create a recordset as Alt tenant, using a zone
   that is owned by Primary tenant.

4) "test_show_recordsets_invalid_ids"
   Use invalid "zone_id" or invalid "recordset_id" to show
   a recordset. Expected: 404 NotFound

Change-Id: Ieb3f19a95718baa7bcf0aaacacc424886e6feaba

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-29 21:50:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add append option to tripleo_derive_hci_parameters module

The module already has the parameter new_heat_environment_path,
which is a path to a file that gets overwritten each time the
module is called. Add append_new_heat_environment_path, which
is a new bool parameter that defaults to false to perserve the
existing behavior. If the new parameter is true, then merge the
new derived paramters into the file without loosing the existing
derived paramters already in the file.

To close bug 1926627, use new_heat_environment_path with the new
option in the existing role loop. Also, remove the unnecessary
task to write out the derived_parameter_result variable because
we now write it in the previous task.

Closes-Bug: #1926627
Change-Id: Iabb0cbda57fabf27d0e5d8b1cc75706785ecd967
'}]
commit_message:
Add append option to tripleo_derive_hci_parameters module

The module already has the parameter new_heat_environment_path,
which is a path to a file that gets overwritten each time the
module is called. Add append_new_heat_environment_path, which
is a new bool parameter that defaults to false to perserve the
existing behavior. If the new parameter is true, then merge the
new derived paramters into the file without loosing the existing
derived paramters already in the file.

To close bug 1926627, use new_heat_environment_path with the new
option in the existing role loop. Also, remove the unnecessary
task to write out the derived_parameter_result variable because
we now write it in the previous task.

Closes-Bug: #1926627
Change-Id: Iabb0cbda57fabf27d0e5d8b1cc75706785ecd967

commit_message:
Add support for RBD fast-diff feature for backups stored in Ceph

    This change enables the FAST_DIFF feature for backup images stored
    via Ceph RBD. It is enabled together with EXCLUSIVE_LOCK and
    OBJECT_MAP as required.

    With FAST_DIFF enabled, the generation of diffs between images and
    snapshots as well as determining the actual data usage of a snapshot
    is sped up significantly.

Closes-Bug #1907964

Change-Id: I5e35de28007558267f9215cbac03a38d7c74612c
(cherry picked from commit 0e8807388209086ee60e1c9f11a48ed6191e4178)
(cherry picked from commit cbf9def32b31bcc3d4894d05e6fe665005006492)

Properly backported.  Should be good.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-03 20:42:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I'll repeat my comment from the stable/victoria backport:

I agree with Jay that this is OK to backport.  This only affects one driver, and if we don't backport it, that driver is subject to the timeout issue when there are targets in the array that aren't connected to OpenStack, which I imagine will be the case for a really large array that's being used for multiple applications.  Further, the new option defaults to what we have now, so it won't affect current users who aren't seeing any issues.  It's low risk and high reward, so a good backport."}]

commit_message:
Add ports filtering support to Dell EMC XtremIO driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Change-Id: I2a521118598de336148a56c1d5352107ece80721
Closes-Bug: #1915800
(cherry picked from commit e175d64cac735e8845165d0e8b48c4a8f2402ea1)
(cherry picked from commit a357ca2755d613ba31556d2f42c120b4cafdc2be)

[{'created': '2021-04-28 20:00:42.000000000', 'message': "Don't ever give up trying to connect to OVN DBs

It doesn't really make since to give up connectimg to the OVN DBs
since we can't do anything without them. If ovsdb-server is slow
and takes more than timeout seconds, everything reconnecting after
partial downloads and starting over is not going to make things
better.

We can change the behavior in ovsdbapp, but doing it without
making non-backportable API changes isn't easily doable.
The plan would be, after merging this back through stable, to
modify ovsdbapp to allow setting different connection and txn
timeouts and being able to disable the timeout in wait_for_change
with a value of -1. Then in the main branch of neutron we can
use that going forward.

Change-Id: Ia9e23113fdeebf0b99085da200c3d61b71567d36
(cherry picked from commit 39ccc0d6d6995b8d50baecc523dd30be034669a9)

commit_message:
Don't ever give up trying to connect to OVN DBs

It doesn't really make since to give up connectimg to the OVN DBs
since we can't do anything without them. If ovsdb-server is slow
and takes more than timeout seconds, everything reconnecting after
partial downloads and starting over is not going to make things
better.

We can change the behavior in ovsdbapp, but doing it without
making non-backportable API changes isn't easily doable.
The plan would be, after merging this back through stable, to
modify ovsdbapp to allow setting different connection and txn
timeouts and being able to disable the timeout in wait_for_change
with a value of -1. Then in the main branch of neutron we can
use that going forward.

Closes-Bug: #1926653

Change-Id: Ia9e23113fdeebf0b99085da200c3d61b71567d36
(cherry picked from commit 39ccc0d6d6995b8d50baecc523dd30be034669a9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-31 21:30:32.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Update SRIOV port pci_slot when unshelving

There are a few things we need to do to make that work:

* Always set the PCIRequest's requester_id. Previously, this was only
  done for resource requests. The requester_id is the port UUID, so we
  can use that to correlate which port to update with which pci_slot
  (in the case of multiple SRIOV ports per instance)

* Call setup_networks_on_host() within the instance_claim context.
  This means the instance's pci_devices are updated when we call it,

* With the two previous changes in place, we can figure out the port's

commit_message:
Update SRIOV port pci_slot when unshelving

There are a few things we need to do to make that work:

* Always set the PCIRequest's requester_id. Previously, this was only
  done for resource requests. The requester_id is the port UUID, so we
  can use that to correlate which port to update with which pci_slot
  (in the case of multiple SRIOV ports per instance).

  This has the side effect of making the fix work only for instances
  created *after* this patch has been applied. It's not ideal, but
  there does not appear to be a better way.

* Call setup_networks_on_host() within the instance_claim context.
  This means the instance's pci_devices are updated when we call it,
  allowing us to get the pci_slot information from them.

With the two previous changes in place, we can figure out the port's
new pci_slot in _update_port_binding_for_instance().

Closes: bug 1851545
Change-Id: Icfa8c1d6e84eab758af6223a2870078685584aaa

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I8ed274000508e1d833dd34a38c588b69cb157d71
