revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-30 11:56:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "cli" prefix from cli-derive-local-hci-parameters.yml

Playbooks which are prefixed with "cli" are not meant to be
run directly by TripleO users. The python-tripleoclient is
supposed to execute them instead. The playbook being renamed
is not executed by the python-tripleoclient but is instead
meant to be run directly by the user so update the name to
follow the convention.

Old name: cli-derive-local-hci-parameters.yml
New name: derive-local-hci-parameters.yml

Closes-Bug: #1926762
Change-Id: Icea13df0c48028013a7f6e45eabdb5d17cecb1ec
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "cli" prefix from cli-derive-local-hci-parameters.yml

Playbooks which are prefixed with "cli" are not meant to be
run directly by TripleO users. The python-tripleoclient is
supposed to execute them instead. The playbook being renamed
is not executed by the python-tripleoclient but is instead
meant to be run directly by the user so update the name to
follow the convention.

Old name: cli-derive-local-hci-parameters.yml
New name: derive-local-hci-parameters.yml

Closes-Bug: #1926762
Change-Id: Icea13df0c48028013a7f6e45eabdb5d17cecb1ec

commit_message:
Write hosts entries per environment

This change will write /etc/hosts entries per plan
rather than stomping the hosts entries every time
the role is used for different stacks / plans.

We achieve this by differentiating the blocks of IP
addresses to ensure they are not modified by unrelated
executions of the role.

Closes-Bug: #1924751
Resolves: rhbz#1933528
Depends-On: I9e53187f37d41d7180e66db1239b5f9c8846addd
Change-Id: I7396ad4d25fec44000ead88b24e818abc107b5f8

commit_message:
Adding five test cases into the 'zone export' test suite.

1) "test_create_zone_export_using_invalid_zone_id"
   Zone export should fail if provided UUID is invalid

2) "test_show_zone_export_impersonate_another_project"
   Admin user is able to impersonate another project
   and to "show" created by tenant exports.
   Note: based on: 'x-auth-sudo-project-id' HTTP header.

3) "test_list_zone_exports_all_projects"
   Use admin client to list the created exports of
   all tenants.
   Note: based on: "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header.

4) "test_export_not_yours_zone"
   Each particular tenant should be able to create an export
   for his owned zones only.

5) "test_create_zone_export_using_deleted_zone"
   Tenant shouldn't be able to create a zone export  for
   non-existing zone.

Change-Id: I98b860fd270e4fad1ab9cc15b3fa47dcbf0361d4

commit_message:
Adding 2 new test cases into a zone suite

1) test_show_zone_impersonate_another_project
   Based on: "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header
   This allows a user to impersonate another project

2) test_list_all_projects_zones
   Based on: "x-auth-all-projects:True"
   If enabled this will show results from all projects in Designate.
   Note: this test case replaced and improved "test_get_other_tenant_zone"
   as it covers more than one single tenant in its test scenario.

Change-Id: I0848299ff9f407aa7918cd12358cad4e17e71e6d

commit_message:
Adding two API test cases to: Accepted Zone Transfer test suite

1) "test_ownership_transferred_zone"
   This test uses 2 clients: "Primary" and "Alt" to request
   and accept zone transfer. When transfer zone is done,
   test will verify that the zone's "project_id" has been
   changed as expected.

2) "test_list_transfer_accepts"
   This test covers list "Zone Ownership Transfers" API.
   Note: "Filter listed result" option is also covered.

Change-Id: Iaf02b076e2e007d533afb5f2e3c441e8ae1546d1

commit_message:
Add RootStackName to group_vars

After a Overcloud deployment, /etc/hosts on the undercloud
will be populated with entries for each overcloud node. Since
we use the same tripleo_ansible roles for both the undercloud
and overcloud deployment, the /etc/hosts file on the Director
will be removed by undercloud install / upgrade operations.

This is outlined here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933528

This change adds the RootStackName to the group_vars,
this is then used by the tripleo_host_entries role in
tripleo-ansible to write host entries per stack.

Closes-Bug: #1924751
Resolves: rhbz#1933528
Change-Id: I9e53187f37d41d7180e66db1239b5f9c8846addd

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 13:02:49.000000000', 'message': 'Sync full /etc/leapp/files directory.

To make the leapp upgrade procedure a little bit simpler the two files
required by leapp to work, repomap.csv and pes-events.json, were being
retrieved from the Undercloud node to the Overcloud nodes. However, the
leapp tool now requires two new files to work properly, which are not
being considered in the upgrade tasks, making the upgrade for the
overcloud nodes fail.

To avoid that the addition of new file requirements will break the
Overcloud leapp upgrade, this patch synchronizes the whole content
under /etc/leapp/files from the Undercloud to the Overcloud nodes using
find, fetch and copy.

Change-Id: I765dc048016bb92462ccd55132e48a61ef8a9ecd
Resolves: rhbz#1953540
'}]
commit_message:
Sync full /etc/leapp/files directory.

To make the leapp upgrade procedure a little bit simpler the two files
required by leapp to work, repomap.csv and pes-events.json, were being
retrieved from the Undercloud node to the Overcloud nodes. However, the
leapp tool now requires two new files to work properly, which are not
being considered in the upgrade tasks, making the upgrade for the
overcloud nodes fail.

To avoid that the addition of new file requirements will break the
Overcloud leapp upgrade, this patch synchronizes the whole content
under /etc/leapp/files from the Undercloud to the Overcloud nodes using
find, fetch and copy.

Change-Id: I765dc048016bb92462ccd55132e48a61ef8a9ecd
Resolves: rhbz#1953540

commit_message:
New API test - test_list_service_statuses

Test scenario:
  Initiate "Service Statuses" API request and make sure that:
  1) All mandatory services are listed in API responce
  2) Each listed service is in "UP" status

Change-Id: Ib11297d5e17df8caf9e8b533c3dccdbe97899dec

commit_message:
Refresh configure-openstack page

Update the configure-openstack page using similar
changes recently made to the focal-wallaby
openstack-base README.

Remove some tacky stuff in the very last section.

Change-Id: I156964c514194f54a5edd7a4c55bcb5de9f023a6

commit_message:
Use openstack ansible collection instead of os_ modules

Replace all usages of os_ modules by openstack.cloud modules.
Change-Id: Id42f15d4e28966d0a0702f3f4566d33f9d129154
(cherry picked from commit c800bcb3b2fe4ca6dc8f06d5f0bb95c65eec35bc)

commit_message:
Updates to flip all libraries back to master

This patchset updates all the requirements for charms.openstack,
charm-helpers, charms.ceph, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests back
to master branch.

Change-Id: I38f603abe72625797824035dd1413685f1407f22

commit_message:
Updates to flip all libraries back to master

This patchset updates all the requirements for charms.openstack,
charm-helpers, charms.ceph, zaza and zaza-openstack-tests back
to master branch.

Change-Id: Ic2d80c0c1eb8e22408ce363fd05b5d66d1d93e4b

[{'created': '2021-04-01 12:07:16.000000000', 'message': 'Adding 3 "False Positive" test cases for a zone suite.

1) test_show_not_existing_zone - expected: "NotFound"
2) test_use_invalid_id_to_show_zone - expected: "BadRequest"
3) test_delete_non_existing_zone - expected: "NotFound"
4) test_update_non_existing_zone - expected: "NotFound"

commit_message:
Adding 4 "False Positive" test cases for a zone suite.

1) test_show_not_existing_zone - expected: "NotFound"
2) test_use_invalid_id_to_show_zone - expected: "BadRequest"
3) test_delete_non_existing_zone - expected: "NotFound"
4) test_update_non_existing_zone - expected: "NotFound"

Change-Id: I0c6751add49b18ae0e4ab3c6e75d33ae12d09078

[{'created': '2021-04-30 00:49:05.000000000', 'message': "Add 2 sec wait to check the import task status

Once Glance finish the import operation(change image status
to active), it move the task to 'success' state but in between of
image become active and task is transitioning to 'success', tempest
try to check the task status and race condition happen.

Adding 2 sec sleep before test fetch the task status. We can add waiter
method also but that will be unnecessary heavy for task status transition.

Closes-Bug: #1926671

commit_message:
Add wait to check the import task status

Once Glance finish the import operation(change image status
to active), it move the task to 'success' state but in between of
image become active and task is transitioning to 'success', tempest
try to check the task status and race condition happen.

Adding waiter method in test for task status check.

Closes-Bug: #1926671
Change-Id: I960b80314f1b0926eca33af830bc827f31cbeda6

commit_message:
Adding new test cases to: "Zone Ownership Transfers" test suite.

1) test_show_transfer_request_impersonate_another_project
   Test is based on: "x-auth-sudo-project-id" HTTP header
2) test_list_transfer_requests_all_projects
   Test is based on: "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header
3) test_zone_transfer_target_project
   Test validates that only targeted project is able to
   accept the transfer request.
4) Improving the existing scenario test: "test_zone_transfer"
   Zone ownership transfer shouldn't work more than once.

Change-Id: I1b345de2c9756ba1bcb0ec7b361c90baff3acb60

commit_message:
Add a service_user section to nova.conf

This is needed in order to prevent long-running actions like
live-migration from failing if the user provided token expires
in the meantime. [0],[1]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/train/admin/live-migration-usage.html#addressing-migration-timeouts
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/train/admin/support-compute.html#user-token-timeout

Change-Id: I00e3a6ac974b73b56b49fadc7751f1c0aaf292ac

commit_message:
Set precision of FRR log message timestamps

Add role var to allow setting the precision of FRR log message
timestamps to the given number of digits after the decimal point.
The default value is 3 (millisecond accuracy).

Change-Id: Iec7e3a18f72106a2c09de7355e9f5a24ba7cffbb

commit_message:
Fix name of networking-ansible/baremetal package

We should install python3-* instead of python2-* in CentOS8.
This change fixes the remaining usage of python2-* left for
netwokring-ansible and networking-baremetal.

Change-Id: I136a81cc857130b3befa5df204525bfa6c6f0206

subject: Remove unused Gerrit ACL for openstack-puppet
messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-05-01 15:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-05-02 10:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-02 16:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nIndeed, it seems this config is used nowhere.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-05-03 16:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-01 15:53:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused Gerrit ACL for openstack-puppet

The openstack-puppet project was removed or renamed nearly a decade
ago, and its entry was cleaned from gerrit/projects.yaml in 2012 by
I06678c8c44141a05288f35421866d635bbd08fb0 but the ACL file for it
was left behind. No other projects used it at that time, and the
same is true today.

Change-Id: If1e6de7163d7a5a3805948a807218613de9d0c7d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused Gerrit ACL for openstack-puppet

The openstack-puppet project was removed or renamed nearly a decade
ago, and its entry was cleaned from gerrit/projects.yaml in 2012 by
I06678c8c44141a05288f35421866d635bbd08fb0 but the ACL file for it
was left behind. No other projects used it at that time, and the
same is true today.

Change-Id: If1e6de7163d7a5a3805948a807218613de9d0c7d

Looks ok:
* new x/xstatic.config is the same as openstack/xstatic.config except the meta-config inheritance

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-01 13:45:14.000000000', 'message': 'Split Xstatic project ACLs between namespaces

A number of Xstatic projects are managed by the OpenStack Horizon
team outside the openstack/ namespace. In order to not have these
inherit from openstack/meta-config, give them a separate copy of
their shared ACL config.

Change-Id: I01d6d4037ba5ae116f91d6d0b6eee26e09144196
'}]
commit_message:
Split Xstatic project ACLs between namespaces

A number of Xstatic projects are managed by the OpenStack Horizon
team outside the openstack/ namespace. In order to not have these
inherit from openstack/meta-config, give them a separate copy of
their shared ACL config.

Change-Id: I01d6d4037ba5ae116f91d6d0b6eee26e09144196

commit_message:
Implement driver vendor passthrough

* Define 'list' and 'call' vendor_passthru methods in Driver
* Add corresponding proxy methods
* Implement unit tests
  - verify result properly returned for list_vendor_passthru
  - verify session is being called properly for both list and call

Story: 2008193
Task: 40960
Change-Id: Id7e5f6d3f651c371efca29002de63c973e8f33d7

commit_message:
Fix hacking check for service client

Tempest hacking check _common_service_clients_check()
still has the ignored_list_T110.txt file check but this
file was already deleted a long back
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/568489

This fix the pep8 check for service client checks otherwise it
fail on finding the ignored_list_T110.txt file.

Change-Id: I6069d1c2f6368e768640ce69981241792ea81aac

messages:
[{'account_id': 31027, 'date': '2021-04-27 06:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-05-03 17:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks! Tiny nit inline'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 06:48:30.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I66b7730f48e5a3723c3580344dccca23392ce719
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I66b7730f48e5a3723c3580344dccca23392ce719

commit_message:
Split Puppet project ACLs between namespaces

There are a couple of projects managed by the Puppet OpenStack team
outside the openstack/ namespace. In order to not have these inherit
from openstack/meta-config, give them a separate copy of their
shared ACL config.

Change-Id: I9dc7cd75d83892c1a3f83ecb9a476b79c1cbb1a9

commit_message:
Split Charms project ACLs between namespaces

There the several projects managed by the OpenStack Charms team
outside the openstack/ namespace. In order to not have these inherit
from openstack/meta-config, give them a separate copy of their
shared ACL config.

Change-Id: I1ed55095169a2144ad8d39a70484becbe6c448f6

subject: Split vexxhost/base-jobs out to its own Gerrit ACL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 17685, 'name': 'Elod Illes', 'email': 'elod.illes@est.tech', 'username': 'elod.illes'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-05-01 13:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-01 17:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Seems logical to split out the vexxhost gerrit ACLs.
base-jobs.config is identical with opendev/project-config.config, which was originally used to vexxhost/base-jobs.
So the patch looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-05-01 21:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

It makes sense to avoid corss-namespace reference in gerrit ACLs. The contents of the new config matches the previous one (i.e. opendev/project-config.config), so LGTM.

On the other hand, gerrit has no namespace for group naming. Perhaps it is better to use a namespace name as a prefix for a gerrit group for a new group. I don't think we need to adjust the existing groups."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-05-01 22:00:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, I've been pondering the namespace challenge for groups over the past year or two. I think we need to come up with a good scheme for them eventually, as we're bound to run into collisions at some point."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-05-03 16:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-05-03 16:51:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-05-03 16:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-01 13:17:17.000000000', 'message': 'Split vexxhost/base-jobs out to its own Gerrit ACL

The vexxhost/base-jobs project started out sharing the Gerrit
configuration for opendev/project-config, but cross-namespace ACLs
create a bit of ambiguity. Give this repository a separate config in
its own namespace.

Change-Id: I58da8e838103223c54112229964e91d85f417cb4
'}]
commit_message:
Split vexxhost/base-jobs out to its own Gerrit ACL

The vexxhost/base-jobs project started out sharing the Gerrit
configuration for opendev/project-config, but cross-namespace ACLs
create a bit of ambiguity. Give this repository a separate config in
its own namespace.

Change-Id: I58da8e838103223c54112229964e91d85f417cb4

There is containers.podman Ansible collection[1] that has all podman modules that you need in this case. I'm working on bringing it as RPM to RDO/OSP, and it will be ready in week or two. I think we don't need to duplicate what's already done, you can just use podman modules from there.
Current code requires a lot to fix to be usable.

[1] https://github.com/containers/ansible-podman-collections"}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-03 11:40:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1
> 
> There is containers.podman Ansible collection[1] that has all podman modules that you need in this case. I'm working on bringing it as RPM to RDO/OSP, and it will be ready in week or two. I think we don't need to duplicate what's already done, you can just use podman modules from there.
> Current code requires a lot to fix to be usable.
> 
> [1] https://github.com/containers/ansible-podman-collections

I was aware that containers.podman existed but I thought it required ansible 2.10. Also, I wanted to backport this to Train. Is there any plan to make this collection available down to train as well?"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-05-03 12:44:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> Patch Set 12:
> 

> I was aware that containers.podman existed but I thought it required ansible 2.10. Also, I wanted to backport this to Train. Is there any plan to make this collection available down to train as well?

It works from ansible 2.8. Yes, it's ported down to train, we use it in tripleo-ansible."}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-03 16:53:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> It works from ansible 2.8. Yes, it's ported down to train, we use it in tripleo-ansible.

Well, Sagi, you're totally right here. It's not exactly the collection but a nicely ported and complete module which I'll use from now on.

Thanks for chiming in, I'll abandon this change."}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-05-03 16:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

podman module ported in tripleo-ansible'}]

commit_message:
[WIP] Introducing the validations_podman library

This library will wrap around podman to execute some actions or
easily inspect containers

The endgoal here is to facilitate the execution of
oslo-config-validator on overcloud nodes to detect anomalies.

Change-Id: I32960c758af9ca7d06432952219529b387457e54

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-01 13:33:07.000000000', 'message': 'Split x/monitorstack out to its own Gerrit ACL

The x/monitorstack project started out sharing the Gerrit
configuration for other projects maintained by the OpenStackAnsible
team within the openstack/ namespace. Give this repository a
separate config in its own namespace in order to not have it inherit
from openstack/meta-config.

Change-Id: I02c4aa71637af8e8f6fd9ceb8945efde359607ec
'}]
commit_message:
Split x/monitorstack out to its own Gerrit ACL

The x/monitorstack project started out sharing the Gerrit
configuration for other projects maintained by the OpenStackAnsible
team within the openstack/ namespace. Give this repository a
separate config in its own namespace in order to not have it inherit
from openstack/meta-config.

Change-Id: I02c4aa71637af8e8f6fd9ceb8945efde359607ec

commit_message:
skip : FS10 and FS20 jobs failing for tempest test

This patch adds FS10 and FS20 jobs into skiplist
criteria to skip "test_hotplug_nic" test and make
these jobs green.

Related-Bug: #1926647
Change-Id: I368a64588e2f9135533182baee1bc06f5586046a

[{'created': '2021-05-03 13:42:48.000000000', 'message': 'Trivial: better guard against malformed data in extra_hardware

We already catch IndexError when processing a line, but not other
errors. A recent regression in python-hardware caused it to raise
TypeError.

Change-Id: Ic6615c1b4017df66783829e54b9f716a9e65b916
'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: better guard against malformed data in extra_hardware

We already catch IndexError when processing a line, but not other
errors. A recent regression in python-hardware caused it to raise
TypeError.

Change-Id: Ic6615c1b4017df66783829e54b9f716a9e65b916

commit_message:
Split x/monasca-vagrant out to its own Gerrit ACL

The x/monasca-vagrant project started out sharing the Gerrit
configuration for other projects maintained by the OpenStack Monasca
team within the openstack/ namespace. Give this repository a
separate config in its own namespace in order to not have it inherit
from openstack/meta-config.

Change-Id: Ic0e50b03c24f7a961f0cb83aa266d9933df33038

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-02 14:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-05-03 07:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-05-03 07:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow+1 by Tobias Urdin <tobias.urdin@binero.se>\n'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-03 14:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-02 14:39:02.000000000', 'message': "Clean up unnecessary workaround related to puppetlabs-apache

Since v5.6.0, mod_packages[1] and mod_libs[2] are automatically set
to the appropriate value in CentOS8, so we don't need to set these
parameters explicitly.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/commit/d346b76d1
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/commit/f31e392a6

Change-Id: Iab5964f54d0e5de0538e02b59ec5be0cdcf926d5
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up unnecessary workaround related to puppetlabs-apache

Since v5.6.0, mod_packages[1] and mod_libs[2] are automatically set
to the appropriate value in CentOS8, so we don't need to set these
parameters explicitly.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/commit/d346b76d1
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/commit/f31e392a6

Change-Id: Iab5964f54d0e5de0538e02b59ec5be0cdcf926d5

subject: bifrost-integration-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial: make non-voting
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-04-30 04:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-04-30 04:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-04-30 08:00:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure I understand the reason behind this change
We don't support focal on stable/train
The bifrost integration job should be left running on xenial as it is on ironic and bifrost in stable/train
Then I agree it could be switched to non-voting as it's non-voting in ironic (but not on bifrost), and on master in openstacksdk"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-04-30 11:20:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'm not sure I understand the reason behind this change
> We don't support focal on stable/train
> The bifrost integration job should be left running on xenial as it is on ironic and bifrost in stable/train
> Then I agree it could be switched to non-voting as it's non-voting in ironic (but not on bifrost), and on master in openstacksdk

I guess the problem here is that the job fails as pip doesn't install any more, and xenial is EOL soon enough anyway.  I guess we can make it non-voting but it will never recover ...

I'm really just interested in making it possible to merge things to openstacksdk stable beaches, train and stein seem to have suffered some bitrot"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-04-30 11:30:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-05-03 08:31:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > I'm not sure I understand the reason behind this change
> > We don't support focal on stable/train
> > The bifrost integration job should be left running on xenial as it is on ironic and bifrost in stable/train
> > Then I agree it could be switched to non-voting as it's non-voting in ironic (but not on bifrost), and on master in openstacksdk
> 
> I guess the problem here is that the job fails as pip doesn't install any more, and xenial is EOL soon enough anyway.  I guess we can make it non-voting but it will never recover ...
> 
> I'm really just interested in making it possible to merge things to openstacksdk stable beaches, train and stein seem to have suffered some bitrot

I totally understand.
train is going EM in less than 3 weeks, I think moving the job to non-voting and keeping xenial is ok
Unless we want to upgrade the same job everywhere (ironic + bifrost), but I have the feeling it won't work very well on focal, maybe bionic. Not sure it's worth it anyway at this point."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-05-03 13:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Approving with a single +2 to unblock the CI'}]

commit_message:
bifrost-integration-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial: make non-voting

This turns this job non-voting, as it is on master branch.  It has
suffered some bit-rot with recent changes to pip, which will need to
be fixed if anyone cares about getting the job going again.

Change-Id: Ife258aa7229afed0099036bb2051be73f695b547

- gate-ironicclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/71/458871/1/check/gate-ironicclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/9e96565/ : SUCCESS in 14m 28s
- python-ironicclient-coverage-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/71/458871/1/check/python-ironicclient-coverage-ubuntu-xenial/e5fed7f/ : SUCCESS in 2m 35s'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-04-23 16:56:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We're importing requests directly in ironicclient.common.http and unit tests, so I think it has to stay."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-04-24 11:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

keystoneauth has a dependency on requests, which means that ironicclient will get requests installed. The reason for removing it here is to minimize the number of places the version string is declared in a potentially conflicting manner.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-04-24 11:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I understand. Still, we use it directly, and AFAIU have to declare its dependency explicitly as well. Or we should reimport it from keystoneauth somehow.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-13 01:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-05-03 13:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning because of inactivity'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-21 15:05:39.000000000', 'message': 'Remove direct dependency on requests

keystoneauth is the library that pulls in requests. If we have client
libraries also depend directly on requests, we can get into situations
for end users in installations where, because of sequencing of client
library releases there are conflicting versions of requests needed and
pkg_resources/entrypoints break.

Remove the direct depend and let keystoneauth pull it in for us.

Change-Id: I769d63869858b03d80b8a85370a5e24f13a22ab4
'}]
commit_message:
Remove direct dependency on requests

keystoneauth is the library that pulls in requests. If we have client
libraries also depend directly on requests, we can get into situations
for end users in installations where, because of sequencing of client
library releases there are conflicting versions of requests needed and
pkg_resources/entrypoints break.

Remove the direct depend and let keystoneauth pull it in for us.

Change-Id: I769d63869858b03d80b8a85370a5e24f13a22ab4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 12:57:40.000000000', 'message': "Support for nested properties with unicode for ironic node

This patch aim to add support for unicode characters
in ironic node properties and its correct representation
as cliutils output.

The problem has been described in the original issue
https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1508419 and related
to Python implementation, shortly:
on 'C' level Python prints the objects using `_repr_`
method and it works differently on Py2 and Py3.
Thats why when node properties consists nested dict,

all unicode characters in the nested part are displayed
as literals.
As part of fix the output representation was changed adding

support for nested properties, but it affects only nested objects.
A few examples bellow:

```python
  >>> from ironicclient.common.cliutils import print_dict
  >>> d1 = {'hello': 'world'}

  >>> print_dict(d1)
  +----------+-------+
  | Property | Value |
  +----------+-------+
  | hello    | world |
  +----------+-------+

  >>> d2 = {'привет': 'пока'}
  >>> print_dict(d2)
  +----------+-------+
  | Property | Value |
  +----------+-------+
  | привет   | пока  |
  +----------+-------+

  >>> d3 = {u'привет': u'пока'}
  >>> print_dict(d3)
  +----------+-------+
  | Property | Value |
  +----------+-------+
  | привет   | пока  |
  +----------+-------+

  >>> d4 = {'hello': {'привет': {u'пока': u'конец'}}}
  >>> print_dict(d4)
  +----------+---------------+
  | Property | Value         |
  +----------+---------------+
  | hello    | привет:       |
  |          |   пока: конец |
  +----------+---------------+
```

Change-Id: I36ff6cea6fad9072db83293fb9b9ac3c4dde0a13
Closes-Bug: #1508419

commit_message:
Support for nested properties with unicode for ironic node

This patch aim to add support for unicode characters
in ironic node properties and its correct representation
as cliutils output.

Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vadim Hmyrov <vhmyrov@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508419
Change-Id: I36ff6cea6fad9072db83293fb9b9ac3c4dde0a13

commit_message:
test_deps: Let test_deps use ceph repo

test_deps can be configured to use --stream/--no-stream,
this patch also adds the possibility of adding the
ceph repo. Also modifies some molecule tests to use the
role test_deps with/without stream and ceph, installing
the extra packages with it.

Change-Id: Iab2fe17de56fec2deffae7bc3b45e775a26c8122

commit_message:
Install RabbitMQ repo key on Ubuntu and Debian

It was missed previously.
CI did not detect it because it ignores apt security issues.
That gets fixed in Ic5abc4b87fd76f87aba383abf43e95ba70629fcb

Change-Id: I11256c674c42e35496146ff64fee1e8e04c30d2c

commit_message:
Remove the sql_max_pool_size option.

The option was replaced 6 years ago[1] by max_pool_size.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/1b7c295d522e26aa8bf09242dcc1355c3fb1ab3e

commit_message:
Centralize arbitrary configurations for libvirt daemons

This is a prep work to add support for separate libvirt daemons and
merge libvirt::config class and libvirtd::virtlogd::config class, so
that we can put arbitary configurations to the single config class
later.

Change-Id: I21357822ae6113e484e94c6e6ab03976f40604eb

commit_message:
Deploy interface that fully relies on custom deploy steps

This change adds a new deploy-interface custom-agent that is essentially
the direct deploy without the write_image step and without bootloader
handling. It's targeted at deployments that need to write the image
differently, while keeping all other aspects the same.

The existing AgentDeploy becomes a subclass of the new CustomAgentDeploy
class, serving as a convenient base class for downstream deploy
interfaces that use IPA.

Change-Id: Ie126ce677c79f102e382305650bddb7f09834483
Story: #2008719
Task: #42059

commit_message:
Update the ironic jobs

The iSCSI deploy interface will be removed in Xena. Stop testing it and
use a newer alias for the other job.

Change-Id: Ib50b8fd0aff1da9e51e63c2ad6e9f9361161301a

subject: Move FFU validations to right playbook.
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-29 06:05:10.000000000', 'message': 'Move FFU validations to right playbook.

In [0], the integration of validations was included. However, they
were added into the tas/upgrade/main.yaml playbook instead of
the tasks/fast-forward-upgrade/main.yml playbook, which is the

commit_message:
Move FFU validations to right playbook.

In [0], the integration of validations was included. However, they
were added into the tas/upgrade/main.yaml playbook instead of
the tasks/fast-forward-upgrade/main.yml playbook, which is the
one being triggered during FFU automation.

Also, it adds back the rescue block in the validation_run_group.yaml
file. As otherwise, if a validation fails then the execution gets
stopped and never gets to run the check for failed validations. And
adds a check for the old release validations.

[0] - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/787411

Change-Id: I2fdd4c3c2c85482cf64f6565ad99cb4b71b00c13

I ran into this today on the cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-lio-barbican job.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-04-20 17:34:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm worried that simply increasing the default will make it more difficult for developers to test stuff locally. Maybe cinder can look into being less resource-hungry? Is this happening because different tests are creating volumes in parallel? As a last resort, how about increasing the value only for the affected jobs instead globally?"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-04-21 08:46:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 
> I'm worried that simply increasing the default will make it more difficult for developers to test stuff locally. Maybe cinder can look into being less resource-hungry? Is this happening because different tests are creating volumes in parallel? As a last resort, how about increasing the value only for the affected jobs instead globally?

Would a 6GB / 15% increase really block anyone in 2021 from deploying c-vol with this backend?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-04-27 10:29:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> I'm worried that simply increasing the default will make it more difficult for developers to test stuff locally. Maybe cinder can look into being less resource-hungry? Is this happening because different tests are creating volumes in parallel? As a last resort, how about increasing the value only for the affected jobs instead globally?

I'm not sure this is really a problem. As this volume is thin-provisioned, the increase shouldn't really affect people who don't use all the size. On the other hand, the tests which are failing will work."}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-04-27 11:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

if this solves the test failures, I agree, 6GB is not that huge increase and it's just a default value/recommended one because it's proven it works as it's tested - that of course doesn't mean that the things don't work with less memory. The value can be still overridden if it's needed for a local environment."}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-04-27 11:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-04-28 13:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Dr. Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>
'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-29 13:53:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Eh, I don't like it either but I guess it's simpler to do it like this nowadays when storage space is rarely the issue."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-05-03 09:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Lee, does this need to be backport it to Wallaby (at least), if not some other older releases?'}]

commit_message:
cinder: Increase VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE

As reported in bug #1920136 the tempest-integrated-compute job has
started to see insufficient free virtual space errors being reported by
c-sch and c-vol when creating volumes. This change simply increases the
default size of the underlying LVM PV used to host these volumes within
the default LVM/iSCSI c-vol backend deployed by devstack.

Change-Id: I965d4a485215ac482403f1e83609452550dfd860
Closes-Bug: #1920136

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-30 12:33:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix getting memory size in some lshw output

Due to a regression in lshw introduced by
https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/60, there are some versions in the
wild that do not return sizes for memory banks <32GiB. In those cases,
work around the problem by looking at the top-level size (if available)
to find the total size. Previously we assumed that we only needed the
top-level size when there was no list of memory banks.

The issue is fixed upstream by https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/65,
but the erroneous patch is still present in the lshw-B.02.19.2-5.el8
package in CentOS 8.4 and 8.5.

Change-Id: I6eb5981d28b9ae368239af0c1d0ec32ff79d95b3
Story: #2008865
Task: 42395
(cherry picked from commit ed791d97786f4ed37bf7b9f18eac8e2af46c3766)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix getting memory size in some lshw output

Due to a regression in lshw introduced by
https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/60, there are some versions in the
wild that do not return sizes for memory banks <32GiB. In those cases,
work around the problem by looking at the top-level size (if available)
to find the total size. Previously we assumed that we only needed the
top-level size when there was no list of memory banks.

The issue is fixed upstream by https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/65,
but the erroneous patch is still present in the lshw-B.02.19.2-5.el8
package in CentOS 8.4 and 8.5.

Change-Id: I6eb5981d28b9ae368239af0c1d0ec32ff79d95b3
Story: #2008865
Task: 42395
(cherry picked from commit ed791d97786f4ed37bf7b9f18eac8e2af46c3766)

Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough versions of setuptools:

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I0dbae46e61056761b0639fbcb181f41fd64bda38

commit_message:
bullseye: set python-path

This varaible makes it's way through to zuul and the
``ansible_python_interpreter`` variable in the inventory.  It seems
that autodetection on Bullseye currently tries to choose python2, so
this will override it.

Change-Id: Ieb6e1dc76ac90936eb64bdeb1bd409472bc20715

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I53f3d2e4581d46abe150c80550b3875bb9ec73b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-03 02:35:19.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I6083f49c2ba2baf80e20968a1f2d809089196613
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I6083f49c2ba2baf80e20968a1f2d809089196613

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I7261114a545c8c016f96ecf20e3fcdc00c3bab99

(2 comments)

Are we assuming that neutron would be disabled when using ephemeral-heat or it would use installed neutron? If the assumption is we only depend on installed mysql and rabbit (as we don't check for neutron in PodLauncher), are we assuming that neutron resources (networks/ports) are already created and relevant parameters passed to stack or inventory already populated? Does not this depend on that work to be complete?"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-17 22:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

Does not this depend on that work to be complete?

It does not require it, b/c you can noop all the existing Neutron resources for now.

I have an example deployment script that shows an example:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slagle/tripleo/master/scripts/deploy-ephemeral-heat.sh
It's gotten a little stale, but the generated ephemeral-heat-environment.yaml that the script creates allows you to deploy with --heat-type pod, and no Neutron.

There is also the passing CI job that does the same thing, where I have configured with the job with enable_heat=False and enable_neutron=False:

I think that CI job is passing because it (and all upstream non-rdo jobs) use deployed-server, deployed-neutron-port.yaml[1] and no network isolation. We should probably test fs001 which is using network isolation with multi nics.

[1]https://83559d6d033060545aff-b1845ff288cbfd02f5ca25d8c978ae51.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/777108/10/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode/07fa519/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud-deploy/overcloud/tripleo-heat-templates/user-environments/config-download.yaml"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-18 11:40:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

Does not this depend on that work to be complete?
> > 
> > It does not require it, b/c you can noop all the existing Neutron resources for now.
> > 
> > I have an example deployment script that shows an example:
> > https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slagle/tripleo/master/scripts/deploy-ephemeral-heat.sh
> > It's gotten a little stale, but the generated ephemeral-heat-environment.yaml that the script creates allows you to deploy with --heat-type pod, and no Neutron.

> 
> [1]https://83559d6d033060545aff-b1845ff288cbfd02f5ca25d8c978ae51.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/777108/10/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode/07fa519/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud-deploy/overcloud/tripleo-heat-templates/user-environments/config-download.yaml

When we make this the default behavior, we will have to make sure it works for all use cases. For ovb, we won't be able to install the undercloud with enable_neutron=False since neutron is still required for Ironic, but we will know if there is any required Heat->Neutron interaction. I have deployed with deployed-server with multi-nics/net-iso before without Neutron, so I don't think there is, unless something was recently changed.

Do you want to block this until we test it with ovb?"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-03-18 11:54:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

> When we make this the default behavior, we will have to make sure it works for all use cases. For ovb, we won't be able to install the undercloud with enable_neutron=False since neutron is still required for Ironic, but we will know if there is any required Heat->Neutron interaction. I have deployed with deployed-server with multi-nics/net-iso before without Neutron, so I don't think there is, unless something was recently changed.
> 
> Do you want to block this until we test it with ovb?

Heat->Neutron interaction would surely be required unless the networks/ports are provisioned outside heat as default or we're using deployed-servers and all port resources are mapped to deployed-server/deployed-neutron-port.yaml.

No, I don't want to block it, but for for it to work in cases where we probably need to use neutron as IPAM (specifically for spine-leaf deployments with segments), we need to ensure that network-data-v2 effort is complete before we make this default."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-18 14:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-18 14:54:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-08 19:38:47.000000000', 'message': 'Support using ephemeral Heat

This patch begins to add support for using the ephemeral Heat process
(heat-all) to the overcloud deploy command.

The functionality is enabled with the newly added --tripleo-deploy cli
arg, which will enable launching a heat-all process that is then used by
the deployment playbooks and modules instead of the managed Heat on the
undercloud (will be removed at a later date).

Implements: blueprint ephemeral-heat-overcloud
Depends-On: I1e8b5e58d4464900abc7f3234e7520c44d7cb0c0
Change-Id: I8fb6ca088b1052488ff4f9ada4d3ab29c0be4735

Change-Id: I8fb6ca088b1052488ff4f9ada4d3ab29c0be4735
'}, {'created': '2021-03-17 22:09:44.000000000', 'message': 'Support using ephemeral Heat

This patch begins to add support for using the ephemeral Heat process
to the overcloud deploy command.

The functionality is enabled with the newly added --heat-type cli arg,
which can be used to select the heat type to be used by the deployment
playbooks and modules.  The options are:

installed: current behavior using Heat installed on the undercloud
pod: ephemeral Heat podman pod (heat-api/engine)
container: ephemeral Heat podman container (heat-all)
native: ephemeral Heat native heat-all process

The default is "installed" initially to preserve the existing
functionality.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint ephemeral-heat-overcloud
Depends-On: I99b488842261775dbbb0308c070e440f71b5be41
Change-Id: I8fb6ca088b1052488ff4f9ada4d3ab29c0be4735
'}, {'created': '2021-03-18 14:23:57.000000000', 'message': 'Support using ephemeral Heat

This patch begins to add support for using the ephemeral Heat process
to the overcloud deploy command.

The functionality is enabled with the newly added --heat-type cli arg,
which can be used to select the heat type to be used by the deployment
playbooks and modules.  The options are:

installed: current behavior using Heat installed on the undercloud
pod: ephemeral Heat podman pod (heat-api/engine)
container: ephemeral Heat podman container (heat-all)
native: ephemeral Heat native heat-all process

The default is "installed" initially to preserve the existing

commit_message:
Support using ephemeral Heat

This patch begins to add support for using the ephemeral Heat process
to the overcloud deploy command.

The functionality is enabled with the newly added --heat-type cli arg,
which can be used to select the heat type to be used by the deployment
playbooks and modules.  The options are:

installed: current behavior using Heat installed on the undercloud
pod: ephemeral Heat podman pod (heat-api/engine)
container: ephemeral Heat podman container (heat-all)
native: ephemeral Heat native heat-all process

The default is "installed" initially to preserve the existing
functionality.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint ephemeral-heat-overcloud
Change-Id: I8fb6ca088b1052488ff4f9ada4d3ab29c0be4735

commit_message:
Bug fix for free space calculation

Instead of calculating the free space ourselves, simply report the
amount of free space that the storage array tells us it has.

Closes-bug: #1918229
Change-Id: Iff02775822056904e5457ecddcefb2e580f47953

subject: Dropping lower constraints testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-03 01:50:14.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ie2676742b862c198d4c6b750fa74cc6afaf1be27
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ie2676742b862c198d4c6b750fa74cc6afaf1be27

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-30 02:13:31.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ifa343da0303d6b15cb9a6bcf6db82fa8317c547b
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ifa343da0303d6b15cb9a6bcf6db82fa8317c547b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-21 07:14:21.000000000', 'message': '[neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

During the VM booting process Nova asks Neutron for the security groups
of the project. If there are no any fields specified, Neutron will
prepare list of security groups with all fields, including rules.
In case if project got many SGs, it may take long time as rules needs to
be loaded separately for each SG on Neutron's side.

During booting of the VM, Nova really needs only "id" and "name" of the
security groups so this patch limits request to only those 2 fields.

This lazy loading of the SG rules was introduced in Neutron in [1] and
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630401/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637407/

Related-Bug: #1865223
Change-Id: I15c3119857970c38541f4de270bd561166334548
(cherry picked from commit 388498ac5fa15ed8deef06ec061ea47e4a1b7377)
'}]
commit_message:
[neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

During the VM booting process Nova asks Neutron for the security groups
of the project. If there are no any fields specified, Neutron will
prepare list of security groups with all fields, including rules.
In case if project got many SGs, it may take long time as rules needs to
be loaded separately for each SG on Neutron's side.

During booting of the VM, Nova really needs only "id" and "name" of the
security groups so this patch limits request to only those 2 fields.

This lazy loading of the SG rules was introduced in Neutron in [1] and
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630401/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637407/

Related-Bug: #1865223
Change-Id: I15c3119857970c38541f4de270bd561166334548
(cherry picked from commit 388498ac5fa15ed8deef06ec061ea47e4a1b7377)

commit_message:
Handle disappearing pids in mlock_report.py

If a pid disappears on us while we're reading, we should just continue
on.

EnvironmentError is just an alias for OSError since Python 3.3, so use
the latter name. [0]

[0] https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError

Change-Id: I3a25cca328e1469f72c84a118a9691c1c0258bc4
Closes-Bug: #1926434

Cleanup RedHat repo

Remove old compatibility code for CentOS 7,
cleanup code and made it more logical and easier
to read. Rework all testing so we test everything.

subject: Deprecate the redundant cinder::backend_host parameter
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-02 11:20:03.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate the redundant cinder::backend_host parameter

The backend_host parameter is currently defined in the two classes,
cinder and cinder::backends, but cinder::backend_host doesn't have
actual implementation and just used to override the other one.
This change deprecates cinder::backend_host so that we can leave only
one parameter to set the backend_host parameter.

Change-Id: If81ff63b36ccaff6e01af49e9cbe44e0c9ec52c3
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate the redundant cinder::backend_host parameter

The backend_host parameter is currently defined in the two classes,
cinder and cinder::backends, but cinder::backend_host doesn't have
actual implementation and just used to override the other one.
This change deprecates cinder::backend_host so that we can leave only
one parameter to set the backend_host parameter.

Change-Id: If81ff63b36ccaff6e01af49e9cbe44e0c9ec52c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-30 18:46:53.000000000', 'message': 'Move some Gerrit ACL files into better namespaces

Some projects did not rename their ACL files when moving into
different namespaces. Move any which are only used by projects in
another namespace into those namespaces, and remove the
openstack/meta-config inheritance from them.

Change-Id: I3cfa5dc2a5ebf5a624f841a72e82ad71090fb4bf
'}]
commit_message:
Move some Gerrit ACL files into better namespaces

Some projects did not rename their ACL files when moving into
different namespaces. Move any which are only used by projects in
another namespace into those namespaces, and remove the
openstack/meta-config inheritance from them.

Change-Id: I3cfa5dc2a5ebf5a624f841a72e82ad71090fb4bf

commit_message:
Fix facts gathering when run with tags

Currently facts are not gathered when role is run with tags
This patch fixes that behaviour and prevents role failure.

Change-Id: If27a6e57c56a0b294442b71aa777d759bc401868
(cherry picked from commit 53db970168dd3847e244173c740470c493f2760e)

subject: wsgi: Handle multiple USR1 signals in quick succession
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-21 22:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-21 22:55:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Something like http://paste.openstack.org/show/797055/ worked as a pretty good test on my dev VM. Exact timings may vary.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-22 18:33:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Apparently signal.pthread_sigmask is new in py33 :-( Looks like we've gotta bust out the ctypes on py2..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-25 06:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-25 19:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-16 20:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-19 20:22:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-10-19 20:33:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't understand the problem

I added a pretty big race:

	diff --git a/swift/common/wsgi.py b/swift/common/wsgi.py
	index 0fe28377f..988f73402 100644
	--- a/swift/common/wsgi.py
	+++ b/swift/common/wsgi.py
	@@ -750,6 +750,10 @@ class StrategyBase(object):
		 # its listen sockets now because ours are up and ready to receive
		 # connections. This is used for seamless reloading using SIGUSR1.
		 reexec_signal_fd = os.getenv(NOTIFY_FD_ENV_KEY)
	+        self.logger.info(
	+            'we gunna signal %r in like a minute' % reexec_signal_fd)
	+        time.sleep(60)
	+        self.logger.info('k we doin it')
		 if reexec_signal_fd:
		     reexec_signal_fd = int(reexec_signal_fd)
		     os.write(reexec_signal_fd, str(os.getpid()).encode('utf8'))


If I go wild with my SIGUSR1 I can see the default processes piling up:

	vagrant@saio:~$ ps -ef | grep proxy
	vagrant  10398     1  2 20:20 ?        00:00:09 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
	vagrant  10520 10398  1 20:26 ?        00:00:00 [swift-proxy-ser] <defunct>
	vagrant  10521 10398  0 20:26 ?        00:00:00 [swift-proxy-ser] <defunct>
	vagrant  10529 10398  1 20:26 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
	vagrant  10534 10398  0 20:26 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
	vagrant  10542 10398  6 20:26 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
	vagrant  10544 10317  0 20:26 pts/0    00:00:00 grep --color=auto proxy


But *someone* is mildly aware of these processes still:

Oct 19 20:27:53 saio proxy-server: Ignoring wait() result from unknown PID 10521
Oct 19 20:27:53 saio proxy-server: Ignoring wait() result from unknown PID 10529
Oct 19 20:27:53 saio proxy-server: Ignoring wait() result from unknown PID 10534

They *do* shutdown:

Oct 19 20:26:52 saio proxy-server: Exited (10521)

and eventually it all sorted itself:

	vagrant@saio:~$ ps -ef | grep proxy
	vagrant  10398     1  2 20:20 ?        00:00:09 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
	vagrant  10542 10398  0 20:26 ?        00:00:00 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
	vagrant  10550 10317  0 20:28 pts/0    00:00:00 grep --color=auto proxy


Maybe I'm confused about where the race is exactly.  Do we have a lot of rouge signals flying at us from random tools or operators?  how robust should this be - is there any risk/cost to trying to do better - what is the value/win exactly?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-20 01:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

You were signalling workers, right? Try pulling that with the managing process, as though you wanted to load up new code or config. You'll need to move your sleep up *before* we register the USR1 signal handler, though.

The bad is that while the re-exec'ed manager is still coming up, another USR1 will just kill it dead, which seems like the opposite of "seamless reload".'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-28 17:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-02-05 19:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-04-30 22:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-04-30 22:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

FWIW, this opens up the window o' bad pretty good:

 diff --git a/swift/common/wsgi.py b/swift/common/wsgi.py
 index 6c903e42c..3cacb4ad0 100644
 --- a/swift/common/wsgi.py
 +++ b/swift/common/wsgi.py
 @@ -1113,6 +1113,7 @@ def run_wsgi(conf_path, app_section, *args, **kwargs):
          running_context[0] = False
          running_context[1] = signum
  
 +    time.sleep(30)
      # context to hold boolean running state and stop signum
      running_context = [True, None]
      signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, stop_with_signal)"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-02 04:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
wsgi: Handle multiple USR1 signals in quick succession

Previously, if another USR1 came in between when the re-exec'd process and
when it set up the signal handler, it'd just die.

Change-Id: Ib2dd9513d3bb7c7686e6fa35485317bbad915876

I've tested the patch in stable/train by first reproducing the original issue, then adding a new device to the config and then applying this patch. Before this patch neutron logged ERROR for device RPs whose parent was the computeRP. After this patch neutron logs ERROR to those device RPs that was created after the faulty bugfix and having the computeRP as a parent.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 16:40:18.000000000', 'message': "Physical NIC RP should be child of agent RP

In the fix for #1853840 I made a mistake and since then we create
the physical NIC resource providers as a child of the hypervisor
resource provider instead of the agent resource provider. Here:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/696600/3/neutron/agent/common/placement_report.py#159

This *did not* break the minimum bandwidth aware scheduling.
But still there are multiple problems:

1) If you created your physical NIC RPs before the fix for #1853840
   but upgraded to after the fix for #1853840, then resource syncs
   will throw an error in neutron-server at each physical NIC RP
   update. That pollutes the logs and wastes some resources since
   the prohibited update will be forever retried.

2) If you created your physical NIC RPs after the fix for #1853840
   then your physical NIC RPs have the wrong parent. Which again
   does not break minimum bandwidth aware scheduling. But it may pose
   problems for later features wanting to build on the originally
   planned RP tree structure.

3) Cleanup of decommissioned RPs is a bit different than expected.
   This cleanup was always left to the admin, so it only changes a
   manual process.

The proper RP structure was and should be the following:

The hypervisor RP(s) must be the root(s).
As a child of each hypervisor RP, there should be an agent RP.
The physical NIC RPs should be the children of the agent RPs.

Unfortunately at the moment the Placement API generically prohibits
update of the parent resource provider id in a PUT request:

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/?expanded=update-resource-provider-detail#update-resource-provider

However not all re-parenting operations are problematic, therefore
we are thinking of relaxing this blanket prohibition. Therefore this
patch will likely need a counterpart in Placement to fix every aspect
of this bug.

However if you take this patch before any of your physical NIC
RPs are created then it's already a complete fix.

Change-Id: I7caa8827d22103600ca685a58294640fc831dbd9
Closes-Bug: FIXME
Related-Bug: #1853840

This *did not* break the minimum bandwidth aware scheduling.
But still there are multiple problems:

1) If you created your physical NIC RPs before the fix for #1853840
   but upgraded to after the fix for #1853840, then resource syncs
   will throw an error in neutron-server at each physical NIC RP
   update. That pollutes the logs and wastes some resources since
   the prohibited update will be forever retried.

2) If you created your physical NIC RPs after the fix for #1853840
   then your physical NIC RPs have the wrong parent. Which again
   does not break minimum bandwidth aware scheduling. But it may pose
   problems for later features wanting to build on the originally
   planned RP tree structure.

3) Cleanup of decommissioned RPs is a bit different than expected.
   This cleanup was always left to the admin, so it only affects a
   manual process.

The proper RP structure was and should be the following:

The hypervisor RP(s) must be the root(s).
As a child of each hypervisor RP, there should be an agent RP.
The physical NIC RPs should be the children of the agent RPs.

Unfortunately at the moment the Placement API generically prohibits
update of the parent resource provider id in a PUT request:

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/?expanded=update-resource-provider-detail#update-resource-provider

Therefore without a later Placement change we cannot fix the RPs
already created with the wrong parent. However we can fix the RPs
to be created later. We do that here. We also fix a bug in the unit
tests that allowed the wrong parent to pass unnoticed. Plus we
add an extra log message to direct the user seeing the pollution
in the logs to the proper bug report.

I expect a follow up patch later, because not all RP re-parenting
operations are problematic, therefore we are thinking of relaxing
this blanket prohibition in Placement. When Placement allows updates
to the parent id we can fix RPs already created with the wrong parent
too.

Change-Id: I7caa8827d22103600ca685a58294640fc831dbd9
Closes-Bug: FIXME
Related-Bug: #1853840

commit_message:
Physical NIC RP should be child of agent RP

In the fix for #1853840 I made a mistake and since then we created
the physical NIC resource providers as a child of the hypervisor
resource provider instead of the agent resource provider. Here:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/696600/3/neutron/agent/common/placement_report.py#159

This *did not* break the minimum bandwidth aware scheduling.
But still there are multiple problems:

1) If you created your physical NIC RPs before the fix for #1853840
   but upgraded to after the fix for #1853840, then resource syncs
   will throw an error in neutron-server at each physical NIC RP
   update. That pollutes the logs and wastes some resources since
   the prohibited update will be forever retried.

2) If you created your physical NIC RPs after the fix for #1853840
   then your physical NIC RPs have the wrong parent. Which again
   does not break minimum bandwidth aware scheduling. But it may pose
   problems for later features wanting to build on the originally
   planned RP tree structure.

3) Cleanup of decommissioned RPs is a bit different than expected.
   This cleanup was always left to the admin, so it only affects a
   manual process.

The proper RP structure was and should be the following:

The hypervisor RP(s) must be the root(s).
As a child of each hypervisor RP, there should be an agent RP.
The physical NIC RPs should be the children of the agent RPs.

Unfortunately at the moment the Placement API generically prohibits
update of the parent resource provider id in a PUT request:

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/?expanded=update-resource-provider-detail#update-resource-provider

Therefore without a later Placement change we cannot fix the RPs
already created with the wrong parent. However we can fix the RPs
to be created later. We do that here. We also fix a bug in the unit
tests that allowed the wrong parent to pass unnoticed. Plus we
add an extra log message to direct the user seeing the pollution
in the logs to the proper bug report.

There may be a follow up patch later, because not all RP re-parenting
operations are problematic, therefore we are thinking of relaxing
this blanket prohibition in Placement. When Placement allows updates
to the parent id we can fix RPs already created with the wrong parent
too.

Change-Id: I7caa8827d22103600ca685a58294640fc831dbd9
Closes-Bug: #1921150
Co-Authored-By: "Balazs Gibizer" <balazs.gibizer@est.tech>
Related-Bug: #1853840

[{'created': '2021-05-02 02:15:04.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

Change-Id: Ia8f41c91024929489c850da0918c9bfe029fd491
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ia8f41c91024929489c850da0918c9bfe029fd491

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 15:08:11.000000000', 'message': "vmware: Handle folder renames in rescue cmd

When a VM is storage-vMotioned, the name of the folder its files are in
can change. Then, a rescue command trying to put the rescue disk into a
folder named after the instance's UUID cannot work anymore and actually
raises a FileNotFoundException for the directory path.

To fix this, we now take the root VMDK's folder and copy the rescue
image into that.

Change-Id: Icef785b96e51942e7bac2df10c116078c77fedc4
Closes-Bug: #1915815
"}]
commit_message:
vmware: Handle folder renames in rescue cmd

When a VM is storage-vMotioned, the name of the folder its files are in
can change. Then, a rescue command trying to put the rescue disk into a
folder named after the instance's UUID cannot work anymore and actually
raises a FileNotFoundException for the directory path.

To fix this, we now take the root VMDK's folder and copy the rescue
image into that.

Change-Id: Icef785b96e51942e7bac2df10c116078c77fedc4
Closes-Bug: #1915815

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 14:06:03.000000000', 'message': "Save instace_id inside Associate Floating IP workflow

Also, rename instance_id field to proper port_id.

Before this change, when instance_id was passed from the Instances
page in the URL, the information would be lost on form submission,
and if the form contained an error, the it would be redisplayed with
the port drop-down containing all ports from all instances. This also
made submitting this form slow, as the drop-down would be populated
with all ports on form validation.

It also creates a bug, where if there are more instances than Nova's
pagination allows, the ports from newer instances would no longer
appear in the drop-down, and the form would fail to validate, even
though the choice of port on initial form was correct.

Closes-bug: #1920010
Change-Id: I3ab26c19dc9ea1ed23fcff790d0db919039099eb
(cherry picked from commit 3d82d57353d1a29fb5b568ffaa93db86998e9d94)
"}]
commit_message:
Save instace_id inside Associate Floating IP workflow

Also, rename instance_id field to proper port_id.

Before this change, when instance_id was passed from the Instances
page in the URL, the information would be lost on form submission,
and if the form contained an error, the it would be redisplayed with
the port drop-down containing all ports from all instances. This also
made submitting this form slow, as the drop-down would be populated
with all ports on form validation.

It also creates a bug, where if there are more instances than Nova's
pagination allows, the ports from newer instances would no longer
appear in the drop-down, and the form would fail to validate, even
though the choice of port on initial form was correct.

Closes-bug: #1920010
Change-Id: I3ab26c19dc9ea1ed23fcff790d0db919039099eb
(cherry picked from commit 3d82d57353d1a29fb5b568ffaa93db86998e9d94)

commit_message:
Save instace_id inside Associate Floating IP workflow

Also, rename instance_id field to proper port_id.

Before this change, when instance_id was passed from the Instances
page in the URL, the information would be lost on form submission,
and if the form contained an error, the it would be redisplayed with
the port drop-down containing all ports from all instances. This also
made submitting this form slow, as the drop-down would be populated
with all ports on form validation.

It also creates a bug, where if there are more instances than Nova's
pagination allows, the ports from newer instances would no longer
appear in the drop-down, and the form would fail to validate, even
though the choice of port on initial form was correct.

Closes-bug: #1920010
Change-Id: I3ab26c19dc9ea1ed23fcff790d0db919039099eb
(cherry picked from commit 3d82d57353d1a29fb5b568ffaa93db86998e9d94)

subject: Fix async race updating nova configs
messages:
[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-04-30 15:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-04-30 15:05:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

thanks'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2021-04-30 15:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-04-30 17:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck this ceph-multistore job seems flaky...'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-30 15:04:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix async race updating nova configs

The configure_neutron_nova function updates nova configs. While that is
still running we separately update nova configs in stack.sh. This can
result in unexpected configs (that don't work). Fix this by waiting for
configure_neutron_nova to complete its work before we do nova config
updates directly in stack.sh.

For specifics we say that:

  [neutron]
  project_domain_name = Default

was missing from both nova.conf and nova-cpu.conf and instances could
not be created because keystone complained about not finding domain in
project. The strong suspicion here is that on some systems
configure_neutron_nova would write out project_domain_name while the
stack.sh inisets were running resulting in stack.sh overwriting the
project_domain_name content.

One theory is that disabling swift makes this problem more likely as
there is swift work in the middle of the async period. This is supported
by the fact that our job that hits this problem does indeed disable
swift.

Change-Id: I0961d882d555a21233c6b4fbfc077cfe33b88499
(cherry picked from commit 06b7352478170521a07875154eef317bde0c5321)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix async race updating nova configs

The configure_neutron_nova function updates nova configs. While that is
still running we separately update nova configs in stack.sh. This can
result in unexpected configs (that don't work). Fix this by waiting for
configure_neutron_nova to complete its work before we do nova config
updates directly in stack.sh.

For specifics we say that:

  [neutron]
  project_domain_name = Default

was missing from both nova.conf and nova-cpu.conf and instances could
not be created because keystone complained about not finding domain in
project. The strong suspicion here is that on some systems
configure_neutron_nova would write out project_domain_name while the
stack.sh inisets were running resulting in stack.sh overwriting the
project_domain_name content.

One theory is that disabling swift makes this problem more likely as
there is swift work in the middle of the async period. This is supported
by the fact that our job that hits this problem does indeed disable
swift.

Change-Id: I0961d882d555a21233c6b4fbfc077cfe33b88499
(cherry picked from commit 06b7352478170521a07875154eef317bde0c5321)

commit_message:
[ffwd] Allow users to replace environment files

A new option allows user to replace the content of specific
environment files which are listed in the "overcloud deploy"
bash script which is parsed and used here.

This is useful when the content of a file is known to
have changed between the source and destination release.
The feature is implemented for FFWD only right now,
but it could be used for any kind of upgrade/update process.

Change-Id: I027770e0ac8c73896d2b57218da3a5063b9707fd
(cherry picked from commit 4458ab622a71b5f86b103df0924817fc3f457b2f)

This is never actually called, only _schedule()
or schedule_create_volume() are used.

It also doesn't appear to work since it passes
the topic as the second parameter to _schedule(),
which should be a request_spec.

Change-Id: I6befa027626dc468eeda8a8f10af0be10caf661a
"}]
commit_message:
filter_scheduler: Remove schedule() method

This is never actually called, only _schedule()
or schedule_create_volume() are used.

It also doesn't appear to work since it passes
the topic as the second parameter to _schedule(),
which should be a request_spec.

Change-Id: I6befa027626dc468eeda8a8f10af0be10caf661a
